programme.title: Pie in the Sky

programme.desc: Crabbe is ordered to track down two OAP fraudsters - but he seems more interested in getting his hands on their recipe for bread-and-butter pudding. Guest starring Joan Sims, with Richard Griffiths and Maggie Steed

programme.title: Pie in the Sky

programme.title: Father Brown

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The Sun Hill bobbies are bemused when a new front-desk officer takes up her post - why does she look so strangely familiar? Starring Simon Rouse, Roberta Taylor and Moya Brady

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: The owner of a medical research establishment begins receiving threats, but a manpower shortage means his complaints are given a low priority at Sun Hill. TDC Brandon Kane tells Danny Glaze that Tina Pope has lodged a complaint against him, while Chandler makes a confession to old friend DI Alex Cullen - who responds by delivering a stern ultimatum. Lewis Collins guests

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Young asks Ashton out on a date and Rickman seduces handsome reporter Simon Kitson - little suspecting he may have an agenda of his own. Gilmore's long-term boyfriend dumps him for good, convinced the sergeant secretly fancies a fellow copper, and Gina Gold crows when an old lady accuses Ackland of robbing her. Taviner and Hollis are called to a warehouse in the dead of night, where events rapidly take a sinister turn

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Cass Rickman is hounded by a lovesick hack and Taviner continues making covert inquiries in a desperate bid to trace Reg Hollis before the day of Simpson's trial, aware that if he fails, his terrible secret will be revealed. Tina Pope also goes missing, filling DC Brandon with misgivings, while DI Cullen prepares to make a shock announcement - is he finally about to blow the whistle on Chandler? Paul Usher stars

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: After Sandra's departure, the detectives are anxious to meet their new boss, and DCI Sasha Miller wastes no time getting cracking with her first Ucos case, the murder of an Italian immigrant on a west London allotment 25 years earlier. The ritualistic style of the killing puts one of the other gardeners in the frame when it's revealed he is a practising druid. However, as the investigation continues, Gerry becomes suspicious of Sasha - why is she kissing a senior officer? Tamzin Outhwaite joins the cast as DCI Miller, with Dennis Waterman, Denis Lawson and Nicholas Lyndhurst

programme.title: Miss Marple
programme.desc: The amateur sleuth is presented with a fresh challenge to her deductive powers while holidaying at the plush Bertram's Hotel in London - a case involving a cleric whose disappearance is seemingly linked to an Irish train robbery. Feature-length mystery, starring Joan Hickson, Caroline Blakiston and Joan Greenwood

programme.title: Catherine Cookson's A Dinner of Herbs
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama based on the novel by Catherine Cookson, starring Billie Whitelaw as a herbalist who takes an 11-year-old orphan under her wing. With Tim Healy, Jonathan Kerrigan and Michael Jayston

programme.title: Call the Midwife
programme.desc: Jenny returns from her stint at the London Hospital and heads straight into one of the most emotive cases of her career when she and Sister Evangelina assist at the birth of a baby with spina bifida. As the parents struggle to come to terms with their son's life-limiting condition, Jenny, who has never delivered a disabled child, also fails to comprehend the far-reaching implications for the family. Meanwhile, Nonnatus House plays host to an acquaintance of Chummy - the Rev Applebee Thornton, an eccentric cleric who befriends Jane. Jessica Raine, Pam Ferris and Dorothy Atkinson star, with a guest appearance by Jason Watkins (Trollied)

programme.title: Atlantic Crossing
programme.desc: America enters the war, and Olav arrives from England. Missy grows suspicious of ties between Roosevelt and Martha, as does Olav. Meanwhile, a dastardly Nazi plot unfolds

programme.title: Inspector Alleyn Mysteries

The apparent murder coincides with the theft of a priceless chalice, testing the sleuth's powers of deduction to their full extent. Crime drama, guest starring David Haig, with Patrick Malahide

As well as following a busy market day, Charlotte discovers the history of markets and how Bakewell is adapting for the future with pop-up shops and also a pop-in health clinic, while Joe Crowley is in East Anglia, where a proposed new multi-billion pound power grid has been met with stiff opposition

All Quiet on the Western Front leads the nominations with a total of 14, closely followed by The Banshees of Inisherin and Everything Everywhere All at Once with 10 each, and rock 'n' roll biopic Elvis, which has nine

programme.desc: There are multiple casualties when an explosion rips through a medical conference with no known cause and some of the Mill staff are caught up in the carnage

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farmer Rhian and her children take their sheep to be judged at the Mid-Somerset Show. Dairy farmer Fred is also returning to defend his championship title, so the pressure is on

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple search for a new home in Devon, but they need help figuring out what they do and don't want from their move to the country. Away from the search, Nicki visits a workshop where traditional sign-writing skills are being kept alive

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon kick off a week of treasure hunting in Kent, where Catherine fancies her chances with a menagerie of mechanical animals, while David's strategy is to try his luck with some very unfashionable items - as well as a hammer that would put any auctioneer's gavel to shame

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Hannah, Claire, Katy and Sally compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu share a passionate reunion but their joy is shortlived when Sharon hears about Nish and Suki's offer on The Vic. Denise is left conflicted when she drunkenly makes a move on Ravi and he turns her down. The ladies of Walford settle in for a lock-in but it becomes apparent that everything can change in a flash

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Scarlett's Driving School
programme.desc: Fifty-six-year-old Linda is desperate to get a driving licence so she can help look after her grandchildren, but as an 'older learner' who is hard of hearing she has failed her test six times. Teaching Linda is her 53-year-old sister Debbie, but after three years in the car together, both of them are at the end of their tethers. Can five days at Scarlett's Driving School help create some calm in the car, and more importantly give Linda the parking and navigation skills she needs to pass at her seventh attempt?

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou struggles to keep up appearances with Col, inviting further suspicion. Desperate to get away from him and clear her conscience, she seeks help from an unexpected source. Bulgey and Artem pay Jade Wilkes a visit to determine whether she revealed the whereabouts of Noel's safehouse to anyone. Drama, starring Leila Farzad

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Bobsleigher Adele Nicoll, ex-footballer Ashley Cain, former rugby player Heather Fisher, MMA star Leah McCourt, Muay Thai fighter Nesrine Dally, Olympic gymnast Nile Wilson and fitness trainers Tyrone Brennand and Waz Ashayer set out to change eight contestants' lives - and help them push themselves to their absolute limit. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: After their individual training sessions, the trainees take on their first head-to-head challenge - a seemingly simply battle to be the first to grab a mallet, get past their opponent and bang a gong. Back at the hacienda, the winners are treated to a slap-up meal served by the losers, although not everyone sees the funny side

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Have I Got News for You
programme.desc: Guest host Jack Dee and panellists Nabil Abdulrashid and Hannah Fry join team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop as they delve into the news. From April 2022

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels have to climb a mountain to save Enid

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The squirrels discover the world of accessorising

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Chilli tries to be a superhero

programme.title: Shaun the Sheep
programme.desc: Pumpkins mysteriously disappear one after another, leaving nothing but a trail of slime

programme.title: Dennis & Gnasher Unleashed!
programme.desc: The pair accidentally do good deeds for the people of Beanotown and go on a 'helping rampage', leaving a wake of mayhem behind them

programme.title: Boy Girl Dog Cat Mouse Cheese
programme.desc: Dog invents a gadget that helps him play fetch alone, but this makes Mouse jealous

programme.title: The Football Academy
programme.desc: It is a big week for striker Nick and the rest of the U-15s team as they travel to Loughborough to take part in the Premier League Nationals tournament

programme.title: The Dengineers
programme.desc: Zoe wants a space so she can carry out messy, noisy science experiments out of earshot of her dad, who works nights

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: A look at why the human body is mostly made of water as the doctors investigate the hypothalamus, the amazing part of the brain that keeps the body hydrated

programme.title: Newsround
programme.desc: Current affairs reports aimed at a younger audience

programme.title: Blue Peter
programme.desc: Mwaksy heads to Sweden for a look around Minecraft HQ with the lucky winner of the Create Something Great competition

programme.title: Deadly Pole to Pole
programme.desc: Steve Backshall takes a four-day journey to Bird Island, a sub-Antarctic landmass home to wildlife including the wandering albatross - which has the largest wingspan of any bird - and giant petrels and skuas. The presenter also dives with fur seals in the freezing waters

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Bakari and the rest of the baboons can see no escape when the lions take over their home - until the pride fall asleep. Baby hippo Mafuta's mother tries to keep the crocodiles from desecrating his dead father's body - but in the ensuing chaos the youngster is swept away down the river. Crocodile Magamba defends her hatchlings and Duma the cheetah struggles to make friends

programme.title: Sort Your Life Out with Stacey Solomon
programme.desc: Four years after the Daniels family moved into their home there are still moving boxes left unopened in the garage leaving little room for the family of five. Stacey, with the help of organiser Dilly, carpenter Rob and cleaner Iwan, puts all their belongings on display in a warehouse for them to see just how much unnecessary clutter they have including 492 DVDs, 35 happy birthday banners, 12 unopened chandeliers and 905 items of baby clothing

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef returns to champion more of the food, history and culture of the county. He begins by foraging for mussels in his favourite rock pools, and touring Bodmin Moor's dark past with his son Jack. He also cooks a fool-proof souffle with artisan Cornish goat's cheese

programme.title: The Best Dishes Ever
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott introduces a selection of recipes from the BBC archives, focusing on dishes that all have something of a kick to them

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: Action from Bathurst, Australia, as the event took place for the first time since 2019 after being postponed on several occasions due to the Covid-19 pandemic

programme.title: How the West Was Won (1962)
programme.desc: Three generations of a pioneering family experience many ordeals and adventures in their endeavour to build a new life for themselves on the American frontier in the 19th century. Over the years, the family experiences the key events of the nation's history, including the gold rush, the Civil War, and the building of the railroads. Western, starring James Stewart, John Wayne, Gregory Peck, Henry Fonda, Debbie Reynolds, Lee J Cobb and Richard Widmark

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin and experts Christina Trevanion and Will Axon travel to the Oxford Union, where they pick out antiques and collectibles to be sold at a local auction - including an autograph book and some etchings by a famous artist. Plus, the presenter goes behind the scenes at the venue, to discover which famous faces debated in the chamber

programme.title: Celebrity Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Consumer journalists Nikki Fox and Matt Allwright hunt for antiques in Kent alongside expert guides Natasha Raskin Sharp and David Harper. As they seek out items to sell at auction, the rookie antiques dealers find the time to learn about William Morris's manifesto to save ancient buildings, and discover the connection between Kentish ragstone and the early Victorian dinosaur hunters

programme.title: Universe
programme.desc: Professor Brian Cox begins his epic exploration of the cosmos, beginning with the great luminous bodies that bring light and warmth to the universe, the stars. Throughout the opening episode, he looks at how stars created life and meaning in the cosmos, from the dawn of time through to the arrival of our own star, the Sun

programme.title: Gravity (2013)
programme.desc: Two astronauts are left stranded in orbit above the Earth when the debris from an exploding satellite destroys their shuttle. Left drifting in space with no way to contact mission control, they begin a perilous journey to reach the safety of a space station before their oxygen supply runs out. Thriller, starring Sandra Bullock and George Clooney

programme.title: Movie Themes at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the best BBC moments and classic archives performances from singers and bands who cracked Hollywood as well as the pop charts. With songs from blockbusters, Oscar-winners, comedies and family favourites featuring a selection soundtrack stars, including Destiny's Child, Paul Simon, All Saints, Simple Minds and Dolly Parton

programme.title: ... Sings Bond
programme.desc: A selection of performances of the Bond theme tunes across the years, including Adele's Skyfall and archive clips of Shirley Bassey's Diamonds Are Forever, Tina Turner's GoldenEye, Tom Jones's Thunderball and Matt Monro's From Russia with Love. Plus, hits by Fun Lovin' Criminals, Sheena Easton, Lulu, Garbage, a-ha and others

programme.title: Moonstruck (1987)
programme.desc: An Italian-American widow agrees to marry an older man - only to fall head over heels in love with his younger brother, leaving her facing an impossible choice. Romantic comedy, starring Cher in an Oscar-winning role, with Nicolas Cage, Olympia Dukakis and Danny Aiello

programme.title: Cher at the BBC
programme.desc: Archive footage of the singer's performances on BBC programmes, including Believe, Love and Understanding, and Walking in Memphis, as well as her first UK chart-topper I Got You Babe, recorded with ex-husband and singing partner Sonny Bono

programme.title: The Lighthouse (2016)
programme.desc: Two men are assigned to keep a lighthouse on an island in the Irish sea in 1801. A freak storm cuts the island off from the mainland for months on end, and the isolation drives both men to the brink of madness, with devastating consequences. Fact-based thriller, starring Mark Lewis Jones and Michael Jibson

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: In the first of four compilation programmes, Monty Don harvests tomatoes from the greenhouse and plants out some of his favourite flowers, for long-lasting summer colour, heleniums. Plus, Carol Klein pays an inspirational trip to an early summer garden in Wiltshire, and Toby Buckland meets a woman in Devon who has created and nurtured her garden over the last 60 years

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Life in a Cottage Garden with Carol Klein
programme.desc: Autumn brings a change of mood to the garden and it is a busy time for the horticulturist - there are seedlings to be pricked out, tidying up needs to be done and harvest time means there is an abundance of seed to collect. Slugs and snails have ravaged the hot borders and Carol cuts back tattered foliage to reduce the damage just in time to open Glebe Cottage to the public under the National Gardens Scheme

programme.title: Weatherman Walking: The Welsh Coast
programme.desc: Derek Brockway is on Gower, but instead of taking the route along Worms Head sets off along a less well-known stretch of coast from Fall Bay to Oxwich. The first half of the walk is along the headland so, to get a closer look at the cliffs, Derek joins a group abseiling into a blow hole and squeezing through a tunnel. Re-joining the pathway, Derek then learns about the area's history of smuggling and deliberate shipwrecking. After walking round the Oxwich headland, he arrives at pretty St Illytd's church. His walk ends on Oxwich beach, where he forages for seaweed with top chef Hywel Griffith

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Best Bites
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt presents more highlights from the series, offering viewers a chance to revisit some of their favourite moments from previous years in the kitchen

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick makes heritage cider with Raynor Winn, author of The Salt Path, and cooks chicken, leek and cider gratin for his friend John Harris, the head gardener at Tresillian House, who regales Rick with his memories of cider-making as a boy. The chef also meets a sea shanty group with a difference

programme.title: Mary Berry's Fantastic Feasts
programme.desc: Mary comes to the aid of three novice cooks - fireman Mark, youth worker Callum and boxing instructor Thaer, who want to throw a spectacular afternoon tea to say thank you to Soraya, who runs a youth charity in Cardiff. While the trio join Mary at her home for a series of cooking lessons, Roman Kemp and Tom Read Wilson oversee the extras to make the party extra special - and also offer moral support when temperatures rise in the kitchen. When everything is ready, they head to Langley Hall near Cardiff to cook their feast for 15, and give Soraya the surprise of a lifetime

programme.title: I Was Monty's Double (1958)
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about actor and army officer ME Clifton-James, whose remarkable resemblance to General Montgomery saw him selected for a special assignment during the Second World War. He was trained to imitate the general perfectly, and sent on a tour of North Africa to keep the real Montgomery's whereabouts unknown to the enemy. Clifton-James stars as both himself and Monty, alongside John Mills and Cecil Parker

programme.title: The Adventures of Robin Hood (1938)
programme.desc: An outlawed nobleman living deep in Sherwood Forest recruits a band of merry men to steal from the cruel Norman aristocracy and redistribute the wealth to the downtrodden peasants. However, they soon face a more pressing task - stopping the evil Prince John and his ally Sir Guy of Gisborne from seizing King Richard's throne. Swashbuckling adventure, with Errol Flynn, Olivia de Havilland, Basil Rathbone and Claude Rains

programme.title: Amanda & Alan's Italian Job
programme.desc: Amanda Holden and Alan Carr join forces to renovate the last two rooms. Their dream of creating an open plan living and dining room is dented when they discover the main structural wall dividing the two spaces requires a much smaller arch than they anticipated. For this final space, they agree to put their design differences to one side, but a disagreement over the shape of the arch threatens to divide them. Away from the task, the duo take a boat trip along the stunning Zingaro nature reserve to get inspiration from the Sicilian landscape, and enjoy sunset on horseback in the ancient Greek city of Selinunte

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Experts Mark Stacey and Catherine Southon appraise antiques at Guildford Cathedral, with items including a Moorcroft bowl and a wooden snuff holder. Presented by Paul Martin

programme.title: Ski Sunday
programme.desc: Action from the Alpine Skiing World Championships in Courchevel and Meribel, France, where Great Britain's Dave Ryding went for gold in the men's downhill event. Plus, an interview with the all-female cast and production crew of ski film Nexus

programme.title: Antiques Roadshow
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the show from Kenilworth Castle, near Coventry. Intriguing treasures brought in for valuation include a miniature safe, one of the world's first interactive golf games, and a trilby belonging to an 1980s pop star. Fiona also delves into the story of a car industry entrepreneur who saved the estate from ruin

programme.title: Secrets of the Jurassic Dinosaurs
programme.desc: Part one of two. Liz Bonnin joins an international team of palaeontologists in the remote badlands of Wyoming as they investigate a mysterious dinosaur graveyard. Packed with over a dozen skeletons including predators such as the fearsome Allosaurus and giants like Diplodocus, as well as fossilised plants and footprints, the site is a treasure trove that is helping to change the way the Jurassic era is seen. The evidence also helps the team to answer why so many dinosaurs came here, and what killed them in such great numbers 150 million years ago

programme.title: The Warship: Tour of Duty
programme.desc: After travellingmore than 20,000 miles, HMS Queen Elizabeth heads from Japan back to of the tropical island Guam for vital maintenance. Soon, however the ship and its escorts are back at sea and sailing towards the disputed waters of the China Sea, where they join up with other allied warships for a display of military might in front of the Chinese navy

programme.title: The Mule (2018)
programme.desc: Earl Stone, an award-winning horticulturist and Korean War veteran, is facing financial ruin. The Illinois octogenarian is estranged from his ex-wife Mary and daughter Iris for always putting work before family. In an attempt to put things right, he becomes a courier for a Mexican cartel. Drama, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Bradley Cooper and Laurence Fishburne

programme.title: Movie Themes at the BBC
programme.desc: A selection of the best BBC moments and classic archives performances from singers and bands who cracked Hollywood as well as the pop charts. With songs from blockbusters, Oscar-winners, comedies and family favourites featuring a selection soundtrack stars, including Destiny's Child, Paul Simon, All Saints, Simple Minds and Dolly Parton

programme.title: Question Time
programme.desc: Fiona Bruce presents the topical debate, inviting a panel of politicians and other guests in Rugby, Warwickshire, to answer questions from an invited audience on subjects that have made the headlines over the past week

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Everyone is excited for the end of term show and Danny has some good news to celebrate but the joy is short-lived when the past catches up with him, leading him to make a choice that could change the course of his life for ever. Drama, starring Angela Griffin, with Kym Marsh

programme.title: Make It at Market
programme.desc: Labourer Mike has a passion for turning wooden bowls but feels held back by his perfectionist attitude to his creations. During the pandemic Sarah quit her job and took up pottery but has been struggling to make enough money from it to live on. With the help and advice of Dom Chinea and his team of experts, Mike and Sarah try their best to create smooth running businesses out of their crafts and turn their hobbies into a day job

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: Wiltshire is the final bargain hunting location, where Margie Cooper hunts down a real mixed bag of offerings, from a large Edwardian shoe sign to an early 20th-century African thumb piano, while Ochuko Ojiri's heart is captured by a set of 1930s hat moulds. Who will come out on top at auction?

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Family and friends Vijai, Sheetal, Jyoti and Rajen compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Winterwatch
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Michaela Strachan reveal some ingenious beetle adaptations in the macro studio at Wild Ken Hill in Norfolk. Megan McCubbin immerses herself in one of our most iconic winter spectacles as she goes swimming with starlings. In Edinburgh, Gillian Burke and Iolo Williams have moved from the cemetery to the river, to explore the city's waterways

programme.title: BBC News at 9
programme.desc: The latest headlines, breaking news and sport from the BBC newsroom.

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win £10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: Murder, Mystery and My Family: Case Closed?
programme.desc: Jeremy Dein and Sasha Wass revisit an infamous 1889 murder case, where a young American woman was charged with poisoning her husband in Liverpool

programme.title: Wonders of the Monsoon
programme.desc: Colin Salmon narrates a documentary exploring how the lives of humans and animals across a vast area of the planet are affected by the transforming power of the monsoon rains. The end of the dry season in northern Australia sees 300,000 flying foxes gathering to drink while running a gauntlet of freshwater crocodiles, while in Sumatra a female orang-utan guides her youngster to where she knows a fig tree fruits at this time of year. At the Delhi stock exchange, the price of rice escalates every day the rains fail to materialise and priests submerge themselves in water and beseech Varuna, god of water, to come

programme.title: Coast and Country Auctions
programme.desc: A visit to the Bala Autumn Sale in Snowdonia, north Wales, where veteran seller Emrys Jones is hoping to get well over £2,000 for each of his dogs - Jim and Ross - at auction

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents as the team values antiques at the Museum of Science and Industry in Manchester. Anita Manning and Michael Baggott examine items including a French book of butterflies and an Inuit carving. Plus, a look at a rare and beautiful art book that is contested at auction

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Ronni Ancona, Nathan Caton, Colin Murray and Sally Phillips go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: Rick visits an organic deer farm near Bodmin Moor ran by Pip and Matt Smith, before returning to the kitchen in Padstow to make a simple venison Wellington. Later, he spends an afternoon on Porthgwarra beach with the artist Hannah Woodman, whose work is inspired by the sea-worn landscape of West Cornwall, before defining the Cornish sense of humour over a pint with comedian Jonny Cowling

programme.title: A Special School
programme.desc: Return of the documentary following life at Ysgol y Der in Penarth, the Vale of Glamorgan, which is Britain's biggest special school. It's the first day back after the summer holidays and headteacher Chris Britten recalls the strain of staying open during the pandemic, while some of the young pupils go on the first field trip of the year. Back at school, staff have to act quickly to try to control the situation when a sixth-former who finds it hard to control his emotions and temper has an outburst and escapes from class. Narrated by Iwan Rheon

programme.title: Mastermind
programme.desc: Clive Myrie invites four more contestants to brave the black chair, who answer questions on the specialist subjects of the plays of Tennessee Williams, US First Ladies from 1945 to the present day, NBA MVP award winners from 2000 onwards, and Mithridates the Great, before they are tested on their general knowledge

programme.title: Only Connect
programme.desc: Victoria Coren Mitchell hosts as the Strigiformes take on the Morporkians in first of the semi-finals as the two teams compete to guess the connections between things that seem utterly random at first glance, with one set of clues asking what links On Top of Spaghetti, Pinocchio's time inside Monstro, Adelaide's Lament, and the cocaine scene in the film Annie Hall

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second round of the student quiz concludes, with two teams of four pitting their wits against one another as they attempt to secure the last place in the quarter-finals. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Parole
programme.desc: An inside look at the high-stakes world of parole hearings, where the futures of prisoners hang in the balance, as well of that of the victims and/or their families. The first episode follows 54-year-old Colin, who committed murder following a pub fight 25 years ago, as he hopes for a chance to be released from prison. Later, serial fraudster David, who spent four decades swindling thousands of pounds out of the women he dated, tries to convince the parole board he is a changed man

programme.title: Detectorists
programme.desc: The return of Mackenzie Crook's award-winning comedy in which he and Toby Jones star as metal detector enthusiasts in search of their hearts' desire. Andy is considering internet dating. Not for him, but for Lance, who is still not over the departure of his ex-wife. Meanwhile, a mysterious stranger arrives to tempt the metal detecting club - in more ways than one. Real-life mother and daughter Diana Rigg and Rachael Stirling co-star, with Gerard Horan and Sophie Thompson

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Victoria Derbyshire

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Suburbicon (2017)
programme.desc: In the summer of 1959, a mild-mannered family man must face his demons after a home invasion shakes his quaint neighbourhood, as he has to navigate the town's dark underbelly of betrayal, deceit, and violence. Black comedy directed by George Clooney, starring Matt Damon, Julianne Moore and Oscar Isaac

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Joe Crowley and Steve Brown head to the North Yorkshire coast and the beautiful village of Staithes to find out how the traditional fishing community is adapting for the future. Where once there was a fishing fleet of 80, now there is just one fishermen left. Joe also goes out to sea to discover how one skipper has swapped nets for wildlife tourism, while Steve takes a look at Staithes' art heritage and tastes some locally-smoked goodies. Adam Henson finds out about the challenges facing a sheep dairy and Charlotte Smith investigates the latest developments behind one of Britain's biggest ecological marine disasters

programme.title: Dragons' Den
programme.desc: Entrepreneurs Peter Jones, Deborah Meaden, Touker Suleyman, Sara Davies and Steven Bartlett preside over more business opportunities, including a clothes-swapping service funded by subscriptions and a hands-free wheelchair made mobile by its user shifting their body weight. Presented by Evan Davis

programme.title: Surgeons: At the Edge of Life
programme.desc: A 17-year-old who developed scoliosis in adolescence has surgery to correct his extremely curved spine. But the procedure has its risks as the spinal cord is at the centre of the vertebrae where the surgeons must operate. The Addenbrooke's team also welcome a 75 -year-old woman who is having an operation to help with her bladder control

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Ireland's Treasures Uncovered
programme.desc: Documentary about the artefacts that have helped to shape and create modern Ireland, both north and south. Alice Roberts and Gavin Hughes uncover the tales behind treasures such as the Tara Brooch, the Broighter Hoard, the Waterford Charter Roll and others

programme.title: Simon King's Shetland Diaries
programme.desc: As the wildlife cameraman and his family's experience on the Shetland Islands comes to an end, he captures footage of gannets diving for fish, films puffins and their chicks underground, observes a pod of killer whales, and follows an otter family's separation as a year-old cub is pushed away by its mother

programme.title: North Sea Connection
programme.desc: Bjorn returns from an overnight stay at the hospital and dismisses Moira's concerns, but it is clear Tuva's investigations are having an impact on him and others in the village. Believing that her burning desire for a child has been thwarted, Adamma goes to confront Aidan at the unit, but makes a shocking discovery about his new business venture

programme.title: North Sea Connection
programme.desc: Shane and Ciara's relationship is put to the the test, while Aidan is banished from his own home. Moira takes drastic action to protect her family

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: First episode of the irreverent comedy with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie. The duo imagine what life would be like with a privatised police force, take arts criticism to its natural conclusion and offer their take on Australian soap operas. First broadcast in 1987

programme.title: A Bit of Fry and Laurie
programme.desc: Comedy sketches with Stephen Fry and Hugh Laurie, featuring an eager-to-please barber and a man who claims to be able to bend spoons. From 1989

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: After years apart, Lionel is reunited with Jean but takes a bigger interest in her daughter. Each believes they have nothing in common any more. First episode of the comedy about late-blossoming love, with Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer. First broadcast in 1992

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: An investigation into a powerful spyware called Pegasus, sold to governments around the world by Israeli company NSO Group, and used on journalists, activists and others, including both the wife and fiancee of Saudi dissident Jamal Khashoggi

programme.title: Ancient Worlds
programme.desc: Richard Miles explores the rise and fall of the Roman empire, which at the height of its power, extended the benefits of its civilisation to a staggering 60 million subjects and citizens, from Hadrian's Wall to the banks of the Euphrates. The archaeologist and historian also learns how the expansion of Christianity filled a gap left by the Roman multi-god belief system, eventually leading to the instalment of Constantine as the first Christian emperor

programme.title: Simon King's Shetland Diaries
programme.desc: As the wildlife cameraman and his family's experience on the Shetland Islands comes to an end, he captures footage of gannets diving for fish, films puffins and their chicks underground, observes a pod of killer whales, and follows an otter family's separation as a year-old cub is pushed away by its mother

programme.title: Come Dancing
programme.desc: Terry Wogan and Veronica Cross present the 1974 final of the inter-regional amateur dance contest from the Lyceum Ballroom in London. Ray McVay and his orchestra accompany the dancers and Barri Haynes provides the commentary

programme.title: La Boheme from the Royal Opera House
programme.desc: Suzy Klein introduces Richard Jones' production of Puccini's opera, performed at the Royal Opera House, Covent Garden in 2020. Sonya Yoncheva heads the cast as the doomed seamstress Mimì, with Charles Castronovo as Rodolfo, who falls in love with her at first sight, and Simona Mihai and Andrzej Filonczyk as on-off lovers Musetta and Marcello. Conducted by Emmanuel Villaume

programme.title: The Classical Collection
programme.desc: A celebration of the newly recognised glories of classical music, featuring a wealth of works written by largely forgotten or neglected composers, including Samuel Coleridge-Taylor, Florence B Price, Grace Williams and Erich Korngold

programme.title: Front Row Late
programme.desc: After migrating to Britain from Australia in the 1960s, Clive James established himself as a caustic and charismatic commentator on popular culture and a pioneer of TV criticism. In his heyday he was one of the most famous faces on British TV, and secured access to some of the biggest stars of the day, including Mel Brooks, Jane Fonda and Frank Sinatra. Here Mary Beard talks to the author, critic and broadcaster in a programme first broadcast in 2018

programme.title: Clive James: Postcard from Rome
programme.desc: Clive spends time in the Italian capital as he goes in search of the dolce vita in the eternal cityand tries to acquire some Roman sophistication. During his stay, he meets a socialite prince and Mussolini's son and learns a lesson from a sexologist

programme.title: Byzantium: A Tale of Three Cities
programme.desc: Historian Simon Sebag Montefiore charts how Istanbul rose to become one of Islam's most powerful cities, and visits the mosques and palaces built by the Ottoman sultans, sharing stories of royal concubines and murderous bodyguards along the way. He also examines how the ancient city was transformed in the 20th century by the secular vision of Turkey's first president Mustafa Kemal Ataturk, who launched a programme of revolutionary social and political reform

programme.title: Opera Italia
programme.desc: Antonio Pappano explores the career of Puccini, visiting his former home near Lucca, the conservatory in Milan where he studied, and locations from his operas, including the Palazzo Farnese and Castel Sant'Angelo in Rome. He also takes a closer look at the composer's original manuscripts, and talks to singers and directors from productions of his best-known works

programme.title: Stewart Copeland's Adventures in Music
programme.desc: The performer continues his mission to understand how music works by exploring its extraordinary power to tell stories. His journey includes meetings with film director Francis Ford Coppola, who explains how simple musical devices transformed the most famous scenes in The Godfather and Apocalypse Now, Sting, who describes the secrets of his song-writing process, rapper Talib Kweli, who looks at the power of music in protest, and the French-Cuban Ibeyi sisters, who show how music has kept the Yoruban tradition alive

programme.title: The Story of Welsh Art
programme.desc: Huw Stephens explores Wales' cultural history, beginning on Anglesey where he steps inside a prehistoric burial chamber to witness Welsh art in its earliest form. He also views an exquisite example of Bronze Age artistry in the shape of a gold cape, found by chance in a field in north Wales and now one of the prize exhibits in the British Museum

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo arrives in Newport, Gwent, where he learns about the heroism of a young boy who was awarded the Albert Medal, before visiting a cinema dating from 1912 in Clevedon

programme.title: The Joy of Painting
programme.desc: Bob Ross offers further advice as he paints another picture, creating a mountain scene with soft, sloping grass cover, a crystal lake and rocky banks

programme.title: The Impressionists - Painting and Revolution
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines the movement's final years, using the artists' last exhibition as a starting point. He explores Van Gogh's time in Paris, how Monet's water lily paintings were affected by his cataracts, and the ways in which Seurat was influenced by academic training and fellow painters. He also finds out how new discoveries in light and optics played a part in the impressionists' images

programme.title: Turner: The Man Who Painted Britain
programme.desc: Tim Marlow presents this documentary drama chronicling the highs and lows of JMW Turner's life, including his tragic childhood, secret affairs and the exhausting extremes to which he pushed himself to capture a unique quality in his paintings. Ross Boatman stars as the artist

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Two Russian film-makers follow the impact of the war inside their country. Their documentary finds that while thousands have fled, those that stayed have had to choose - to oppose, support or stay silent

programme.title: Big Sky, Big Dreams, Big Art: Made in the USA
programme.desc: Waldemar Januszczak examines the golden age of American art, beginning in the Wild West with the art of the Hudson River School, before culminating in a celebration of the work of Jackson Pollock, a native of Wyoming who was heavily influenced by the mood of the American West and the example of Native American artists

programme.title: Romancing the Stone: The Golden Ages of British Sculpture
programme.desc: Alastair Sooke examines the three 'golden ages' of British sculpture and the technical breakthroughs that made them possible. He begins with a look at the Norman ecclesiastical building programme and the masterworks created by anonymous medieval masons and artisans to the glory of God - until Henry VIII's Reformation brought wholesale destruction

programme.title: The Impressionists - Painting and Revolution

programme.title: My Life
programme.desc: Coding Genius follows 11-tear-old Emmanuella, who has a passion for coding. She hit the headlines in the UK after setting up lessons for school kids like her and is determined to go further. Now based in the Nigerian capital Abuja, Emmanuella has work to do - she wants to pass on her love of coding to other girls in the city and launches CodeKid, an after-school, weekend and holiday club for girls aged 6 - 15. But will they turn up, or will the thought of coding keep them away? In this short film, we find out what started Emmanuella's love of coding, and get to know her extraordinary ambitions for changing the world, one coding club at a time.

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Delivery Duckling arrives and tells Love Monster he has been chosen to be sipping host at a special Hot Chocolate Day ceremony. She then cycles off before telling him what a sipping host does. Love Monster goes to Elder Panda to ask his advice, and he tells him there are many ways to serve hot chocolate - each person needs to find their own unique way. Elder Panda adds honey and banana from his garden to his. Love Monster starts the ceremony by adding his signature marshmallows, but then Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny announces she puts marshmallows in hers too. Love Monster thinks he needs to use something more unusual, so he adds pickles, but this doesn't go down well - in fact, it tastes horrible! It turns out the reason why he was chosen was so that he could make hot chocolate the way he always makes it. He does, and everyone loves it.

programme.title: The Toddler Club
programme.desc: Nigel, Benjee Bear and Bailee Bear welcome toddlers Seren, Ella, Dylan, Erin and Betsy, and their grown-ups, to the Toddler Club. Parents, carers and their little ones at home are invited to join in with all the fun activities too! The What’s in the Box? game reveals a wooden birthday cake, and when the toddlers and parents open up a bigger box, they discover lots more objects and toys that are inspired by a birthday party theme. This subject is explored through play, song and story. Grown-ups are encouraged to take part at home by hiding a safe, toddler-appropriate birthday party toy or object inside a recycled box for them to reveal and explore with their toddler! Storytime is all about fun and playful discovery, as the Toddler Twins’ friend Koala throws a surprise birthday party for Panda! Viewers at home show how they’ve been exploring the birthday party theme too. And, The Big Band Song gets everyone moving about, before some calm time with stretching and the Goodbye song.

programme.desc: Waffle tries to impress on his first day as a listening dog at school

programme.title: Tee and Mo
programme.desc: Baby monkey Tee gets involved in cake-making, but gets more on his face than he does in the baking tin, so Mo tries to clean him up with a face wipe

programme.title: Pablo
programme.desc: The little boy sees a picture of a pineapple and gets the taste in his mouth that won't go away. Soon everything and everyone in the Art World looks and tastes like pineapple too

programme.title: Yakka Dee!
programme.desc: Dee encourages a friend to say ‘hair' and we go on a whirlwind word adventure

programme.title: Numberblocks
programme.desc: Twenty-One helps some new friends find out how many rectangles they can make. Learn about the numbers 23 and 24 and explore arrays with the Numberblocks.

programme.title: Alphablocks
programme.desc: A makes friends with a cat, but it quickly becomes clear she is allergic to her new feline pal

programme.title: Dog Loves Books
programme.desc: All the lights go out, so Dog and Pug explore all the night-time activities around them.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels find Duggee cleaning and repairing his collection of antiques

programme.title: Love Monster
programme.desc: Tiniest Fluffiest Bunny joins Love Monster for a sleepover in a tent, but things do not go according to plan

programme.title: Let's Dance
programme.desc: Learn a swing- and K-pop-inspired routine with Miss Kylie.

programme.title: Something Special
programme.desc: Justin and his friends go up, up, up and away having fun playing aeroplanes. Meanwhile, Mr Tumble turns his home into a hotel and has some very important guests flying in.

programme.title: Teletubbies
programme.desc: When Po goes on the Tubby Custard Ride it makes lots of Tubby Custard - too much for Po to eat alone. So, the Teletubby choo-choos off to get Tinky Winky, Dipsy and Laa-Laa so all of the Teletubbies can share it. In Tummy Tales, children take a ride on a steam train

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Ubercorn and Glitch have to team up when they get stuck at the most remote place on Earth.

programme.title: My Petsaurus
programme.desc: It's a rainy day and Chloe is happily playing indoors, but Topsy would rather go outside.

programme.title: Maddie's Do You Know?
programme.desc: Maddie learns how a camera works and discovers how a hairbrush is made in a factory

programme.title: Dog Squad
programme.desc: Newfoundland Sylvie is a big therapy dog with big soft cuddles who loves to help people when they’re worried. She and her owner, Katrina, visit all sorts of people every day, young and old. Today Sylvie and Katrina are visiting a doctor’s surgery to help a little boy called Ben. Ben has fallen off his scooter and grazed his knee, and his mum says he’s too nervous to come into the doctor’s room. Sylvie’s mission is to help Ben feel brave enough to see Dr Stevens. First, she gives Ben one of her biggest and best cuddles. Then, she and Dr Stevens show Ben how a doctor treats a patient. Sylvie loves performing in the starring role. Ben finally feels brave enough to go into the doctor’s room with his mum. But when Ben gets frightened and runs from the room, Sylvie must use all her superpowers to help him be braver still.

programme.title: Swashbuckle
programme.desc: Gem and her teams of Swashbucklers try to win her jewels back from pirates Cook, Line and Sinker. Game show for children

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels are tidying up- its ‘Bring your Grandparents to Squirrel Club Day'. Duggee has his Grandparents badge so he knows what they will like - a nice cup of tea. But on arrival, these grandparents seem more of a lively bunch than Duggee was expecting

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: The bunny sets his sights on Mr McGregor's pumpkin patch, and rolling it out of the garden turns into an exciting ride

programme.title: Andy's Global Adventures
programme.desc: Andy, Jen and Scout head off on a global adventure to Borneo in search of orangutans

programme.title: Pinocchio and Friends
programme.desc: There are rumours throughout the city of a sea monster haunting the river, but luckily two monster hunters, the Fox and the Cat, just arrived! Unaware of their deception, Pinocchio and Freeda want to help them hunt the monster, but they’re taking too long. Freeda decides to use her pirate monster call, and a real monster appears: the fearsome and superangry Shark… Now, what will the Fox and the Cat do?

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: It's Dad's turn to drop the kids off at school

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: Bingo uses her 'dance mode' wishes on her dad!

programme.title: Go Jetters
programme.desc: Cartoon following four adventure-seeking superheroes as they explore places all around the world. The Go Jetters try to fix the Eiffel tower after Grandmaster Glitch breaks it while using it as a TV aerial

programme.title: Molly and Mack
programme.desc: Molly examines her shelf of special things at the back of Mack’s stall. She chooses the tub of blue slimy stuff and remembers the day she got it. Caitlin is in her new den, but she’s in a bit of a grump and doesn’t want to share it with anyone. When Euan, Ruby and Ayesha try to get in, she becomes an even bigger grump. Ruby has dropped a book about monsters and this gives Caitlin an idea – she’s going to pretend her den has a monster to scare the others away! Meanwhile, Moira is trying to track down a different kind of monster – a biscuit snaffling one. She asks Bob to put a camera up in her office to find out who has been eating all her biscuits. Caitlin tells everyone about the monster. His name is Grump, and he oozes blue slimy stuff. Ayesha is very sceptical, so Caitlin borrows a tub of blue slimy stuff from Mack’s stall and smears it all around Moira’s office. She calls Ayesha in to see the slime as evidence of Grump’s existence, but Ayesha remains suspicious. Moira and Bob look t

programme.title: Biff and Chip
programme.desc: After making promises to both Biff and Wilf, Chip pretends to be ill to get out of playing with Biff. But can he escape when Doctor Biff and Anneena confine him to his sick bed?

programme.title: Sarah & Duck
programme.desc: The duo make a colourful new friend during breakfast

programme.title: JoJo & Gran Gran
programme.desc: JoJo and Gran Gran are drinking hot chocolate in the park café when a robin lands on their table. JoJo learns that some birds fly away in the winter - that's called migration.

programme.title: Moon and Me
programme.desc: Mr Onion's best friend Dibillo is going to visit his bridge for tea - but where is he?

programme.title: Clangers
programme.desc: Major makes Baby Soup Dragon a one-dragon band kit. It turns out not to be a good idea

programme.title: In the Night Garden

programme.title: The Lost Boys (1987)
programme.desc: Two teenage brothers move with their mother to a coastal town in California, where the eldest falls in with a local biker gang. He soon discovers that his new friends are vampires and he is turning into one himself, forcing his younger brother to team up with a pair of heavily armed comic shop employees to battle the undead and save his soul. Comedy horror, starring Kiefer Sutherland, Jason Patric, Dianne Wiest, Corey Feldman and Corey Haim

programme.desc: The latest political news and debate, and reports from around Wales. Presented by James Williams

programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hears how people are preparing for Lent in Lincolnshire, hearing stories of kindness and compassion, and the Rev Kate Bottley meets a Gainsborough woman who took in a Ukrainian couple and their pet dog. Songs from Lincoln Cathedral include All My Hope on God Is Founded, O Jesus I Have Promised and Father Hear the Prayer We Offer

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple wanting to uproot from Essex and find a modest cottage in Cornwall to call their forever home. The two nurses have a budget of £340,000

programme.title: A Shaun the Sheep Movie: Farmageddon (2019)
programme.desc: When an alien with amazing powers crash-lands near Mossy Bottom Farm, Shaun the Sheep goes on a mission to shepherd the intergalactic visitor home before a sinister organisation can capture her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Justin Fletcher, John Sparkes and Amalia Vitale

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: Only one challenge separates the remaining four cooks from a place in this year's Young MasterChef final. Head Chef Kerth is hitting the pass to run a restaurant-style service

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: Kerth Gumbs and Poppy O'Toole judge the final of the culinary contest. The finalists must concoct an appetite-whetting starter followed by a showstopper dish that incorporates all their creativity and learning from the competition

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Baby hippo Mafuta is in crisis. His pod has been taken over by a marauding male and his mother must take him far away from the river. Kali the lioness tries to dig the warthogs out of the den, but there's an unexpected twist when the rest of the pride gets involved. As the land dries, the lake becomes a place of refuge for the thirsty herds - but as things go from bad to worse, Bakari leads the baboons in search of better foraging, while Nalla and the elephants set off in search of water

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith head to Bakewell Livestock Market in Derbyshire, as hundreds of sheep and cattle are auctioned. Among the farmers looking to make a penny or two is Keith Harrop, who is hoping to get top dollar for one of his beef cattle, but will business be brisk enough? As well as following a busy market day, Charlotte discovers the history of markets and how Bakewell is adapting for the future with pop-up shops and also a pop-in health clinic, while Joe Crowley is in East Anglia, where a proposed new multi-billion pound power grid has been met with stiff opposition

programme.title: British Academy Film Awards
programme.desc: Richard E Grant hosts the annual awards show from the Royal Festival Hall in London, while Alison Hammond is on hand to catch up with the winners and losers backstage. For the first time ever, the evening culminates in a live broadcast to reveal the final four category winners. All Quiet on the Western Front leads the nominations with a total of 14, closely followed by The Banshees of Inisherin and Everything Everywhere All at Once with 10 each, and rock 'n' roll biopic Elvis, which has nine

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Noye and Palmer arrange to smelt the stolen gold and sell it back into the market, with the profits given to Cooper and Parry to launder. McAvoy demands that houses be bought for his wife and his girlfriend - but Cooper worries this is a big mistake. Meanwhile, investigating officer Brian Boyce suggest Customs and Excise might be able to help - and the team have a breakthrough when they learn about the cash purchase of a smelter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Manchester United v Leicester City at Old Trafford and Tottenham Hotspur v West Ham United at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The Red Devils and Spurs will both have expected three points at home to struggling sides to aid their respective bids to at least finish in the top four. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick (1987)
programme.desc: Three single women dabble in magic to conjure up the perfect lover, and unintentionally summon Satan himself, who seduces them one by one. They come to realise the danger the lecherous devil presents and decide to end their relationships, but the infernal rogue does not take kindly to rejection. Fantasy comedy based on John Updike's novel, with Jack Nicholson, Cher, Michelle Pfeiffer and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: 24/7 Pet Hospital
programme.desc: Puppy Coal, from the Dogs Trust is treated for aspiration pneumonia, caused by food going into his lungs. Border Collie puppy Grayson has broken his leg after falling off a bed and needs an operation to fix it. A new scan technique is used for the first time to check if labradoodle Poppy is cancer free

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A cabbie trying to make a quick buck in a crash-for-cash scam puts his livelihood on the line, and the chips are down for a woman involved in a freak accident in a takeaway

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in St Helens, Merseyside to view a three-bed mid-terrace with ominous signs of damp. She also heads to a rural part of West Lothian in Scotland to visit a four-bed detached house that has seen better days, but has the potential to be a beautiful family home. Martin Roberts is in Launceston, Cornwall, where a one-bed flat with a wonderful view but a short lease is on offer

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams trawl the antiques shops in Shepton Mallet in Somerset with experts Colin Young and Kate Bliss. Charlie Ross learns how profitable an old Pokemon card collection can be

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: There are multiple casualties when an explosion rips through a medical conference with no known cause and some of the Mill staff are caught up in the carnage

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farmer Rhian and her children take their sheep to be judged at the Mid-Somerset Show. Dairy farmer Fred is also returning to defend his championship title, so the pressure is on

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple search for a new home in Devon, but they need help figuring out what they do and don't want from their move to the country. Away from the search, Nicki visits a workshop where traditional sign-writing skills are being kept alive

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon kick off a week of treasure hunting in Kent, where Catherine fancies her chances with a menagerie of mechanical animals, while David's strategy is to try his luck with some very unfashionable items - as well as a hammer that would put any auctioneer's gavel to shame

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Hannah, Claire, Katy and Sally compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu share a passionate reunion but their joy is shortlived when Sharon hears about Nish and Suki's offer on The Vic. Denise is left conflicted when she drunkenly makes a move on Ravi and he turns her down. The ladies of Walford settle in for a lock-in but it becomes apparent that everything can change in a flash

programme.title: X-Ray
programme.desc: Lucy Owen goes undercover in Caerphilly to look at the problems wheelchair users face accessing public transport

programme.title: Food Fest Wales
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food market in Hay-on-Wye, getting tips on home growing and finding out the secret to making fudge. Onkar Singh Purewal is in Cardiff to discover how setting up a food stall has provided a lifeline for some in the community, and in Ceredigion he discovers the key to making sourdough bread. Farmer Meinir Howells gets to grips with turning rapeseed into oil in Ruthin

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou struggles to keep up appearances with Col, inviting further suspicion. Desperate to get away from him and clear her conscience, she seeks help from an unexpected source. Bulgey and Artem pay Jade Wilkes a visit to determine whether she revealed the whereabouts of Noel's safehouse to anyone. Drama, starring Leila Farzad

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Bobsleigher Adele Nicoll, ex-footballer Ashley Cain, former rugby player Heather Fisher, MMA star Leah McCourt, Muay Thai fighter Nesrine Dally, Olympic gymnast Nile Wilson and fitness trainers Tyrone Brennand and Waz Ashayer set out to change eight contestants' lives - and help them push themselves to their absolute limit. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: After their individual training sessions, the trainees take on their first head-to-head challenge - a seemingly simply battle to be the first to grab a mallet, get past their opponent and bang a gong. Back at the hacienda, the winners are treated to a slap-up meal served by the losers, although not everyone sees the funny side

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

Plus, Brentford v Crystal Palace, Brighton & Hove Albion v Fulham, Chelsea v Southampton, Everton v Leeds United and Wolverhampton Wanderers v Bournemouth

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Highlights of the latest fixtures, including Celtic v Aberdeen, Livingston v Rangers and Hibernian v Kilmarnock

programme.title: The Lost Boys (1987)
programme.desc: Two teenage brothers move with their mother to a coastal town in California, where the eldest falls in with a local biker gang. He soon discovers that his new friends are vampires and he is turning into one himself, forcing his younger brother to team up with a pair of heavily armed comic shop employees to battle the undead and save his soul. Comedy horror, starring Kiefer Sutherland, Jason Patric, Dianne Wiest, Corey Feldman and Corey Haim

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Match of the Day
programme.desc: Gary Lineker presents highlights of the latest Premier League matches, including Aston Villa v Arsenal at Villa Park and Nottingham Forest v Manchester City at the City Ground and Newcastle United v Liverpool at St James' Park.
