programme.title: Sunday with Laura Kuenssberg
programme.desc: Interviews with key politicians and public figures

programme.title: Sunday Morning Live
programme.desc: Ashley John-Baptiste and Holly Hamilton lead a debate asking whether migrants are demonised in Britain. Also, how being fashionable doesn't have to be expensive, or bad for the planet, and a song from Tommy Blaize, one of the singers on Strictly Come Dancing

programme.title: The Sunday Show
programme.desc: Martin Geissler presents the main issues from the world of politics and beyond, featuring interviews, discussion and analysis on the stories that matter to Scotland

programme.title: The Bidding Room
programme.desc: Another three sellers enter the Bidding Room in the hope of persuading the dealers to part with their cash in exchange for their items. They include Kasia, with a wind-up toy monkey who clashes his cymbals together, and Joy, with an antique Kings and Queens playing card game. Also hoping to make some cash is Chris, who discovered an ornate lead cherub while renovating his barn and believes it began life as part of a water feature in a stately home

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Experts David Harper and Charles Hanson help two teams look for items at the Oswestry Showground in Shropshire, while Natasha Raskin Sharp finds out about rare Faberge flowers

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Songs of Praise
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher hears how people are preparing for Lent in Lincolnshire, hearing stories of kindness and compassion, and the Rev Kate Bottley meets a Gainsborough woman who took in a Ukrainian couple and their pet dog. Songs from Lincoln Cathedral include All My Hope on God Is Founded, O Jesus I Have Promised and Father Hear the Prayer We Offer

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a couple wanting to uproot from Essex and find a modest cottage in Cornwall to call their forever home. The two nurses have a budget of £340,000

programme.title: A Shaun the Sheep Movie: Farmageddon (2019)
programme.desc: When an alien with amazing powers crash-lands near Mossy Bottom Farm, Shaun the Sheep goes on a mission to shepherd the intergalactic visitor home before a sinister organisation can capture her. Animated comedy, with the voices of Justin Fletcher, John Sparkes and Amalia Vitale

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: Only one challenge separates the remaining four cooks from a place in this year's Young MasterChef final. Head Chef Kerth is hitting the pass to run a restaurant-style service

programme.title: Young MasterChef
programme.desc: Kerth Gumbs and Poppy O'Toole judge the final of the culinary contest. The finalists must concoct an appetite-whetting starter followed by a showstopper dish that incorporates all their creativity and learning from the competition

programme.title: Serengeti
programme.desc: Baby hippo Mafuta is in crisis. His pod has been taken over by a marauding male and his mother must take him far away from the river. Kali the lioness tries to dig the warthogs out of the den, but there's an unexpected twist when the rest of the pride gets involved. As the land dries, the lake becomes a place of refuge for the thirsty herds - but as things go from bad to worse, Bakari leads the baboons in search of better foraging, while Nalla and the elephants set off in search of water

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: Adam Henson and Charlotte Smith head to Bakewell Livestock Market in Derbyshire, as hundreds of sheep and cattle are auctioned. Among the farmers looking to make a penny or two is Keith Harrop, who is hoping to get top dollar for one of his beef cattle, but will business be brisk enough? As well as following a busy market day, Charlotte discovers the history of markets and how Bakewell is adapting for the future with pop-up shops and also a pop-in health clinic, while Joe Crowley is in East Anglia, where a proposed new multi-billion pound power grid has been met with stiff opposition

programme.title: British Academy Film Awards
programme.desc: Richard E Grant hosts the annual awards show from the Royal Festival Hall in London, while Alison Hammond is on hand to catch up with the winners and losers backstage. For the first time ever, the evening culminates in a live broadcast to reveal the final four category winners. All Quiet on the Western Front leads the nominations with a total of 14, closely followed by The Banshees of Inisherin and Everything Everywhere All at Once with 10 each, and rock 'n' roll biopic Elvis, which has nine

programme.title: The Gold
programme.desc: Noye and Palmer arrange to smelt the stolen gold and sell it back into the market, with the profits given to Cooper and Parry to launder. McAvoy demands that houses be bought for his wife and his girlfriend - but Cooper worries this is a big mistake. Meanwhile, investigating officer Brian Boyce suggest Customs and Excise might be able to help - and the team have a breakthrough when they learn about the cash purchase of a smelter

programme.title: Match of the Day 2
programme.desc: Mark Chapman reviews the day's Premier League action, featuring Manchester United v Leicester City at Old Trafford and Tottenham Hotspur v West Ham United at Tottenham Hotspur Stadium. The Red Devils and Spurs will both have expected three points at home to struggling sides to aid their respective bids to at least finish in the top four. Plus, a round-up of yesterday's goals

programme.title: Sportscene
programme.desc: Amy Irons presents action from Motherwell v Hearts at Fir Park, plus a look back at yesterday's fixtures

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick (1987)
programme.desc: Three single women dabble in magic to conjure up the perfect lover, and unintentionally summon Satan himself, who seduces them one by one. They come to realise the danger the lecherous devil presents and decide to end their relationships, but the infernal rogue does not take kindly to rejection. Fantasy comedy based on John Updike's novel, with Jack Nicholson, Cher, Michelle Pfeiffer and Susan Sarandon

programme.title: Weather for the Week Ahead
programme.desc: A look ahead to the latest forecast

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Morning Live
programme.desc: Kym Marsh and Gethin Jones host the weekday magazine show featuring a mixture of topical chat and expert advice

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: Dominic Littlewood highlights innovative methods used to catch criminals. A mother arrives home with her newborn baby, only for masked burglars to smash in, and a dashcam reveals a van driver's criminal behaviour before a crash

programme.title: Claimed and Shamed
programme.desc: A cabbie trying to make a quick buck in a crash-for-cash scam puts his livelihood on the line, and the chips are down for a woman involved in a freak accident in a takeaway

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martel Maxwell is in St Helens, Merseyside to view a three-bed mid-terrace with ominous signs of damp. She also heads to a rural part of West Lothian in Scotland to visit a four-bed detached house that has seen better days, but has the potential to be a beautiful family home. Martin Roberts is in Launceston, Cornwall, where a one-bed flat with a wonderful view but a short lease is on offer

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: The teams trawl the antiques shops in Shepton Mallet in Somerset with experts Colin Young and Kate Bliss. Charlie Ross learns how profitable an old Pokemon card collection can be

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: There are multiple casualties when an explosion rips through a medical conference with no known cause and some of the Mill staff are caught up in the carnage

programme.title: The Farmers' Country Showdown
programme.desc: Farmer Rhian and her children take their sheep to be judged at the Mid-Somerset Show. Dairy farmer Fred is also returning to defend his championship title, so the pressure is on

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Nicki Chapman helps a London couple search for a new home in Devon, but they need help figuring out what they do and don't want from their move to the country. Away from the search, Nicki visits a workshop where traditional sign-writing skills are being kept alive

programme.title: Antiques Road Trip
programme.desc: David Harper and Catherine Southon kick off a week of treasure hunting in Kent, where Catherine fancies her chances with a menagerie of mechanical animals, while David's strategy is to try his luck with some very unfashionable items - as well as a hammer that would put any auctioneer's gavel to shame

programme.title: Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Work colleagues Hannah, Claire, Katy and Sally compete for cash by crossing a bridge of stepping stones across the studio floor. Quiz show, hosted by Ross Kemp

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with co-host Alex Brooker

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon and Keanu share a passionate reunion but their joy is shortlived when Sharon hears about Nish and Suki's offer on The Vic. Denise is left conflicted when she drunkenly makes a move on Ravi and he turns her down. The ladies of Walford settle in for a lock-in but it becomes apparent that everything can change in a flash

programme.title: Food Fest Scotland
programme.desc: Edith Bowman takes Colin Murray on a food adventure in her home town of Anstruther. As well as its famous fish and chips, they discover how artisan bread is being made for the community. Farmer Jim Smith tests his tastebuds with some hot sauces and discovers the secrets of marmalade. Chef Julie Lin is in Dundee finding out how bakers keep up with demand around the clock

programme.title: Better
programme.desc: Lou struggles to keep up appearances with Col, inviting further suspicion. Desperate to get away from him and clear her conscience, she seeks help from an unexpected source. Bulgey and Artem pay Jade Wilkes a visit to determine whether she revealed the whereabouts of Noel's safehouse to anyone. Drama, starring Leila Farzad

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: PG Tips and Lipton's are world-famous tea brands and an undercover investigation reveals that women working on plantations producing them are being pressured to have sex with their bosses in return for work. The report focuses on plantations that have been owned for years by two British companies - Unilever and James Finlay and Company - who between them have produced half the tea drunk in the UK. Reporter Tom Odula has spoken to dozens of women who say they have been sexually assaulted or harassed, while undercover footage reveals how one young woman was targeted for sex at a job interview

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Bobsleigher Adele Nicoll, ex-footballer Ashley Cain, former rugby player Heather Fisher, MMA star Leah McCourt, Muay Thai fighter Nesrine Dally, Olympic gymnast Nile Wilson and fitness trainers Tyrone Brennand and Waz Ashayer set out to change eight contestants' lives - and help them push themselves to their absolute limit. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: After their individual training sessions, the trainees take on their first head-to-head challenge - a seemingly simply battle to be the first to grab a mallet, get past their opponent and bang a gong. Back at the hacienda, the winners are treated to a slap-up meal served by the losers, although not everyone sees the funny side

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus current affairs, arts and entertainment, and weather

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is joined by actor Jason Watkins and fellow chefs Vivek Singh and Shivi Ramoutar. Helen McGinn chooses the wines to go with the studio dishes and there are clips from the BBC food archive featuring Rick Stein, Marcus Wareing, Nigella Lawson and Keith Floyd

programme.title: The Great Food Guys
programme.desc: Chef Nick Nairn and presenter Dougie Vipond go al fresco, making smoked fish scotch eggs with a chunky salad. Singer and actress Clare Grogan joins them in the kitchen to chat and try out the delicious food and drink combination

programme.title: Football Focus
programme.desc: Alex Scott looks ahead to the weekend's fixtures, including Nottingham Forest v Manchester City. Plus, news from the lunchtime match between Aston Villa and Arsenal

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Anita Manning hosts the show from Belfast and pays a visit to one of the city's most famous bars. Ben Cooper and Charles Hanson assist the teams in finding a bargain

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore unearths a pair of floral chairs, a chipboard chest of drawers and a collection of antique hardware from the rubbish heap, hoping to breathe new life into them and make some cash for the original owners

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin takes in the delights of Derbyshire with a couple from Leeds who are keen to see a range of properties with all the trimmings. Jonnie also visits a local cafe where customers take household items to be repaired rather throwing them away

programme.title: Final Score
programme.desc: Jason Mohammad presents a round-up of the results and this afternoon's news from the Premier League, EFL and Scotland

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Celebrity Mastermind
programme.desc: Actress and comedian Debra Stephenson, journalist and broadcaster James O'Brien, comedian and writer Shaparak Khorsandi and hairstylist Sam McKnight are in the famous black chair, answering questions on John Lennon, the books of JD Salinger, the adventures of Asterix and 1970s disco music

programme.title: Celebrity Bridge of Lies
programme.desc: Ross Kemp hosts the game show, which sees comedians Susan Calman, John Thomson, Jon Culshaw and Shazia Mirza taking it in turns to cross the floor by only stepping on the correct answers - and doing their best to avoid the wrong ones. For the final crossing, those who have been successful join forces for a chance to take home the money for their chosen charities

programme.title: Michael McIntyre's Big Show
programme.desc: Michael presents another hour of entertainment, featuring Ellie Goulding singing Like a Saviour, Jermaine Jenas handing over his mobile in Send to All and a duet from the two Unexpected Stars of the Show. Plus, a contestant on The Wheel gets the surprise of her life when her edition keep getting more bizarre

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Sheila Ferguson, Glenn Moore, Roxy Shahidi, Sonia, Dave Berry, Manish Bhasin, Katherine Dow Blyton and Richie Anderson step up to the podiums in an effort to find the least likely correct answers in this celebrity edition. Hosted by Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Dylan clashes with an old rival, Robyn and Paul make a life-changing decision, and Stevie seeks comfort from Marcus

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden

programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: The Chronicles of Belfast
programme.desc: The seasonal account of the city ends in winter, when despite the challenges of the cold, wet weather, there is a lot going on in the wilder parts of the city. In Colin Glen, Alannah and Paul search the river for fossils washed down from the hills by the rainfall, while glass artist Dagmara shows her garden, which she has turned into a personal nature reserve. Up on Black Mountain Aaron organises a group of schoolchildren to plant 100 trees - and his conservation work does not go unrecognised

programme.title: Food Fest Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Colin Murray visits the Walled City Market in Londonderry, where he finds out about a brown sauce revival and the advantages of getting fish from a fishmonger. He also goes in search of the perfect Irish stew and finds out which tasty street food was brought here by a well-travelled entrepreneur. Ryan Hand gets to grips with Japanese food and chef Suzie Lee reveals how Greek-style yoghurt is being made in County Down

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: Bobsleigher Adele Nicoll, ex-footballer Ashley Cain, former rugby player Heather Fisher, MMA star Leah McCourt, Muay Thai fighter Nesrine Dally, Olympic gymnast Nile Wilson and fitness trainers Tyrone Brennand and Waz Ashayer set out to change eight contestants' lives - and help them push themselves to their absolute limit. Presented by Jordan North and Paul Olima

programme.title: Go Hard or Go Home
programme.desc: After their individual training sessions, the trainees take on their first head-to-head challenge - a seemingly simply battle to be the first to grab a mallet, get past their opponent and bang a gong. Back at the hacienda, the winners are treated to a slap-up meal served by the losers, although not everyone sees the funny side

programme.title: The Graham Norton Show
programme.desc: Judi Dench talks about her heart-warming film Allelujah, while Paul Rudd and Michael Douglas - stars of Marvel's Ant-Man and the Wasp: Quantumania - also pop in for a chat. Greatest Showman Hugh Jackman talks about his role in The Son, a powerful drama about fatherhood, Michael B Jordan promotes boxing sequel Creed III, while Eugene Levy discusses his new TV series The Reluctant Traveller. Plus, there's music from P!nk, who performs her new single Trustfall

programme.title: Serbia: The Russia Dilemma
programme.desc: As the first anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine approaches, the majority of people in almost every European country are opposed to the war… with one notable exception. Serbia has long been an ally of Russia, with close political and economic links. It's thought more than 70% of Serbs support Moscow over Kyiv. In the capital, Belgrade, pro-Russian graffiti can be seen on walls, while souvenir shops sell President Putin merchandise and even pro-war symbols. So, where does it come from? Is it historical links between two Slavic and Orthodox nations, is it realpolitik or is something more insidious at play? BBC Newsnight's International Correspondent Joe Inwood travelled to Serbia to investigate

programme.title: Bittersweet Medicine
programme.desc: A toddler with a rare and devastating inherited condition has become the first child to be treated in the UK with a lifesaving gene therapy. The drug, called Libmeldy, is the most expensive medicine in Europe, costing nearly three million pounds ($3.48m) per patient. For the family it is bittersweet as only one of the two children can be saved. The BBC's medical editor Fergus Walsh has followed the treatment at Royal Manchester Children's Hospital over several months and has this exclusive report

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The sleuth is visited by Ernestine, the wife of a burglar known as 'Sad Freddie'. While breaking into a house he discovered a body and is so alarmed he has fled the country. The trail leads Maigret to a dentist who lives with his domineering elderly mother. Drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: The green-fingered sleuths are hired to work behind the scenes of a garden makeover TV show, but Rosemary has an accident while standing in for the programme's star and ends up in hospital. Realising someone is trying to sabotage the series, Laura teams up with no-nonsense presenter Quinnie Dorell (Belinda Lang) to catch the culprit. Drama, starring Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are hired to create a restaurant garden on Italy's Ligurian coast, but it is not long before their working holiday is disrupted by a murder. Determined to solve the crime before returning home, they find themselves with no shortage of suspects - and matters are complicated further by a second death. Guest starring Suzanne Bertish (Rome) and Tristan Gemmill (Casualty), with Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The detective investigates when a victim of fraud is found murdered on a golf course - but his inquiries are complicated by the discovery of a tramp's mutilated body nearby. To make matters worse, beautiful singer Bella Duveen is also around, seemingly intent on helping herself to a grim souvenir. David Suchet stars, with Hugh Fraser, Bill Moody and Jacinta Mulcahy

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth heads to Lake Windermere for a holiday with faithful assistant Hastings, only to find his crime-solving skills are once again needed to investigate a murder. The only witness to the crime is a dog, leaving Poirot with a difficult task to find the killer. David Suchet stars, with Kate Buffery, Patrick Ryecart and Julia St John

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: The sleuth has retired to a charming English village in the hope of finding peace and quiet. However, the murder of a rich industrialist neighbour forces him to leave his new lifestyle behind as he plunges into a sordid world of blackmail and envy, aided by the dogged Chief Inspector Japp. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, Philip Jackson, Malcolm Terris and Oliver Ford Davies

programme.title: Lewis
programme.desc: A professor is found dead on Halloween with a stake through her heart and Hobson reveals she shared a house with the victim in her university days. A medium visits Lewis claiming to have foreseen the tragedy, and ghostly messages spelled out in fridge magnet letters start appearing in a house occupied by four students. As the detective struggles with the possibility his friend is somehow implicated in the crime, a tale of jealousy and revenge begins to unfold. Rupert Graves (Sherlock) and Niamh Cusack (Heartbeat) guest star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Troy is playing in an annual cricket match between Midsomer Worthy and Fletchers Cross when tragedy strikes. The wife of one of the team captains, a wealthy local landowner, is found battered to death with a cricket bat in a quarry. As Barnaby and Troy investigate, they discover no end of people with a grudge against the victim's husband - who may have been complicit in some other suspicious deaths. Guest starring Imelda Staunton and Robert Hardy

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: A fox-hunt turns sour when a tramp is found dead in the woods, and matters are further complicated by the murder of the chief suspect's father. As DCI Barnaby investigates, he concludes it is only a matter of time before another member of the tight-knit community suffers the same fate. Guest starring James Bolam

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: A cleaner is found dead in her home and suspicion immediately falls upon her lodger, who is arrested and convicted of her murder. It appears to be an open-and-shut case, but Superintendent Spence begins to question the man's guilt and invites Poirot to help uncover the identity of the real killer. The Belgian sleuth teams up with crime writer Ariadne Oliver (My Family's Zoe Wanamaker) as he tries to crack the case. Whodunit, starring David Suchet, with Richard Hope, Joe Absolom, Amanda Root, Sian Phillips and Raquel Cassidy

programme.title: On the Buses
programme.desc: Jack and Stan volunteer Olive as supervisor for the depot nursery. However, when she breaks her glasses and has to go home for a spare pair the clueless duo are left holding the fort. Comedy, starring Reg Varney, Bob Grant and Anna Karen

programme.title: Doc Martin
programme.desc: Mark is forced to investigate his fiancee's past when a stranger arrives in the village with a mysterious photo. Mrs Tishell finally removes the neck collar she has worn for years, and suffers a prolapsed disc as a result. Martin reveals his true feelings for Louisa over a few glasses of wine, but he drinks too much and wakes the next morning to a waiting room full of giggling patients, a raging hangover and a distinct feeling of uneasiness

programme.title: Maigret
programme.desc: The police think an elderly woman is dreaming when she claims someone is moving her belongings, but then she is found murdered and Maigret is called in to investigate. Detective drama, starring Michael Gambon

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Part one of two. While holidaying in Cornwall with his friend Captain Hastings, the sleuth meets a local woman who has seemingly become unaccountably accident-prone - but soon starts to suspect she is actually a victim of foul play. David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Poirot
programme.desc: Japp and Poirot investigate the murder of an actress's estranged husband, only to find in the theatrical world, where deception and play-acting are a way of life, nothing is quite what it seems. In time-honoured fashion, it initially looks as though the butler did it - but subsequent inquiries throw up a veritable rogues' gallery of equally likely suspects. Philip Jackson, David Suchet and Hugh Fraser star

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: Barnaby visits his Aunt Alice, who is recovering from an operation at a nursing home, and finds himself in the middle of a mystery. A resident has been found dead and the official verdict is a heart attack, but as rumours of fraud and deception abound, Alice's friend believes someone may have conspired to commit murder

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: An archaeologist posing as Rosemary dies mysteriously during a dig for Anglo-Saxon artefacts in the grounds of Lord Engleton's stately home, presenting the duo with a fresh mystery to solve. The gardens are unaccountably blighted by yellowing, forcing the estate to close its gates to the public, and a second death suggests somebody will go to any lengths for a piece of British history. Guest starring Julian Wadham

programme.title: Rosemary & Thyme
programme.desc: Laura and Rosemary are called in to investigate when gardens entered for a village contest are attacked by a disease. Further sinister undercurrents are exposed when reigning champion Donald Westward is found dead and recriminations start to fly as buried rivalries come to the surface. Felicity Kendal and Pam Ferris star

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell follow Kathleen Fraser Jackson's search for her mother, with the 62-year-old having been trying to track down the woman who gave her up for adoption for more than 40 years. In a last-ditch attempt to help Kathleen find her mum, the Long Lost Family team samples Kathleen's DNA and adds it to an online database, which triggers an epic journey spanning continents and cultures, and unlocking more secrets - and family members - than she could ever have dreamed of

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's Silk Road Adventure
programme.desc: As Joanna's Silk Road Adventure draws to a close, she travels across the Central Asian states of Uzbekistan and Kyrgyzstan. Starting in the Kyzylkum desert, she explores the citadel of Khiva, a town infamous for its history of slavery. A high-speed train then whisks her to the magnificent 14th-century architecture of Samarkand, before heading to mountainous Kyrgyzstan, where she meets DJs, K-Pop groups, eagle hunters and yak herders. Finally, her journey ends near the Chinese border, at the old Silk Road caravanserai of Tash Rabat

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney receives a series of anonymous phone calls, which he realises may be linked to a series of murders in which the victims were all important community figures killed by someone who leaves dead birds as a grisly calling card. The threat forces Sidney to question whether he can reconcile his relationship with Amanda and his calling as a vicar. Leonard bonds with Hilary as she cares for her dying father, while Geordie's investigation of the killings leads him to a mysterious home for people with disabilities. Detective drama set in the 1950s, starring James Norton and Robson Green

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: Sidney and Geordie join a local cricket team to play a match against nearby Whittlesford, but team captain Geoff Towler (Peter Davison) seems to have an objection to talented young Pakistani batsman Zafar, and is even willing to forfeit the game to spite the player. After the match, a buffet ends badly when contaminated beer leaves everyone feeling ill, a matter Geoff is keen for Geordie to cover up. However, a worse fate awaits Zafar, who is later found to have received a fatal dose of the poison his teammates and spectators had received

programme.title: Upstairs, Downstairs
programme.desc: King Edward VII visits Eaton Place for a lavish dinner party, but the servants' duties are interrupted by the untimely appearance of Sarah, who is unfortunately expecting a new arrival of her own. Gordon Jackson and Jean Marsh star

programme.desc: Leonard gets caught up in an armed robbery at the village post office, and manages to identify the masked culprit. programme.title: On Her Majesty's Secret Service (1969)
programme.desc: While on leave, James Bond prevents a young woman - Teresa 'Tracy' Draco - from committing suicide. Her father is Marc-Ange Draco, the head of a powerful crime syndicate who is impressed by Bond and wants him to protect his daughter by marrying her. In exchange, he offers Bond information that will lead him to master criminal and arch-enemy Ernst Stavro Blofeld, who is intent on destroying world peace by means of a lethal virus unless he receives an international amnesty for his crimes. Spy adventure, starring George Lazenby in his only outing as 007, alongside Telly Savalas, Diana Rigg, Gabriele Ferzetti and Bernard Lee

programme.desc: An assassination attempt is made on a diplomat, who survives and is rushed to hospital. Action thriller, starring Wesley Snipes and Zoe Bell

programme.title: Magnum, PI

programme.title: Minder

programme.title: The Saint

programme.title: The Memoirs of Sherlock Holmes
programme.desc: Two sisters receive unwanted gifts at Christmas - severed human ears. Holmes is enlisted to discover where they came from - and uncovers a disturbing tale of deceit and infidelity. Jeremy Brett stars in his curtain call as the famous detective

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Jeremy Wade investigates the mysterious deaths of fishermen in Alaska. A recent fatal incident sends him on a search for possible suspects - first through treacherous rapids, then down to the river-mouth where the icy waters are swarming with sharks. Yet it's an unexpected beast, hauled up from the depths, that eventually emerges as his deadliest contender

programme.title: River Monsters

programme.title: Magnum, PI

programme.title: The Sweeney

programme.title: Minder

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: In Fiji's South Pacific paradise, people are coming under attack. Plunging off the beaten track into the remote mountains of the island's interior, freshwater detective Jeremy battles tropical storms and unforgiving jungles in an all-out search for victims, clues, and culprits. Colourful stories of monstrous fish are woven into the local folklore, but how much of this is fanciful, and how much of it is real?

programme.title: River Monsters
programme.desc: Extreme angler Jeremy Wade investigates the stories behind supposedly deadly freshwater creatures, beginning by examining whether piranhas deserve their fearsome reputation. programme.title: Live Snooker: Players Championship
programme.desc: Coverage of day one from Aldersley Village in Wolverhampton, featuring the opening two last-16 matches, played over the best of 11 frames. This is the second of three tournaments that make up the Duelbits Players Series, and Mark Allen took the honours in the opener, the World Grand Prix. He is likely to be among the men to beat once again, along with Masters champion Judd Trump and last year's title-winner here Neil Robertson. Jill Douglas presents, with analysis from Stephen Hendry, Alan McManus, Neal Foulds and Ken Doherty, commentary by David Hendon and Phil Yates, and reports from Rob Walker

programme.title: Mad Max Beyond Thunderdome (1985)
programme.desc: The nomadic warrior pitches up in the city of a cut-throat desert community in search of his stolen vehicle and ends up making a deal with a local dictator to get rid of her rival for power. However, when the bargain turns sour, he is cast out into the wilderness - where he becomes the unlikely protector of a tribe of feral youngsters. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Mel Gibson, Tina Turner and Bruce Spence

With their budget of £140,000, property expert Jean Johansson lines up five stunning homes for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Laura Hamilton meets Andi and Neil from York, who dream of retiring permanently to Spain with their son Joel and spaniel Dixie. They're looking for a three-bedroom house with a dog-friendly garden, where barbeque enthusiast Neil can cook up a storm close to the beach close to the coastal town of Mazarrón, near Murcia. Laura has five sizzling options for their budget of £145,000, but will any of them turn out to be their new forever home?

programme.title: Chateau DIY
programme.desc: Billie focuses on a furniture renovation, while Ben wallpapers for the first time. Julia converts her former artist's studio into living accommodation at her woodland chateau

programme.title: A Lake District Farm Shop
programme.desc: Farm shop buyer Alex travels to Morecambe Bay for a visit to Furness Fish, who trawl for shrimps to create the local delicacy of potted brown shrimp, a tradition dating back to the 18th century. A soap-maker, who uses milk from her own cow, hopes to win new business with her latest dog shampoo products, while a muesli maker prepares a bid for a place at the hotel buffet table

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: Bettany Hughes' Treasures of the World
programme.desc: The host travels to Saudi Arabia and Jordan, and visits the iconic sites and undiscovered jewels that are only just becoming accessible to tourists. From the natural beauty of the Red Sea, with its outstanding corals and marine life, to the ancient rock art and desert camps of local Bedouin tribes, testament to humanity's connection to this awe-inspiring landscape over millennia

programme.title: Living Wild: How to Change Your Life
programme.desc: Sophie Morgan heads to the Lake District, the Scottish Borders, Leicestershire and the Inner Hebrides to meet people building new lives around the things they love. In Leicestershire, she meets up with Rachel and Sally, a couple in their 60s who are at the very beginning of a big life change. They have just taken delivery of a narrowboat shell which they are kitting out themselves before setting out on 'one last adventure'

programme.title: Mile 22 (2018)
programme.desc: A team of American intelligence officers, part of a top-secret tactical command unit, attempt to smuggle a police officer with sensitive information out of Indonesia. Thriller, starring Mark Wahlberg and Lauren Cohan

programme.title: The Italian Job (2003)
programme.desc: A crook double-crosses his partners in crime, a betrayal that leaves their friend and mentor dead. One year later, they regroup and come up with a daring plan to exact revenge on the traitor and reclaim their ill-gotten gains. Crime thriller inspired by the 1969 movie, starring Mark Wahlberg, Charlize Theron, Edward Norton, Seth Green and Donald Sutherland

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef visits beachside restaurant Barefoot Bob's in Hull, Massachusetts, owned by husband-and-wife team Marc and Lisa. Every year profits nosedive through the bleak winter months, and matters aren't improved when it becomes clear they have both lost their passion - not only for the business but also for each other. With the restaurant and marriage on the line, Gordon tries to help turn things around before it's too late

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer and Bart perform street magic in a bid to impress passers-by and raise enough cash to pay a mechanic's bill. Unfortunately, they quickly realise people are suckers for a sob story, and start conning the public for money. Featuring the guest voice of Edward Norton

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Bedfordshire, Tom and his wife Naomi kick things off with an upmarket menu, which fails to leave an impression. On day two Victoria and her boyfriend Elliot cook up a massive Caribbean feast featuring a controversial goat curry. On the final night magician Neil and his fiance Charlie plan to wow their guests with a mysterious menu and magical entertainment

programme.title: Hollyoaks Omnibus
programme.desc: Extended edition of the soap

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Sussex, where Simon uses coloured resins to create a table from aluminium panels, and Henry tries his hand at upcycling some unwanted office chairs

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In 2010, Phil Spencer helped 18-year-old student Claire, who was looking for a wheelchair-accessible flat on London's South Bank with a view of the river. Claire had £1.7million to spend, gained from a personal injury settlement. In 2012, Kirstie Allsopp was searching south London for a flat for Jen. She had spent the previous year in Kabul, Afghanistan, and had high expectations of what she could get for her budget. Now Phil catches up with both to see how they are getting on

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: In 2010, Phil Spencer helped 18-year-old student Claire, who was looking for a wheelchair-accessible flat on London's South Bank with a view of the river. Claire had £1.7million to spend, gained from a personal injury settlement. In 2012, Kirstie Allsopp was searching south London for a flat for Jen. programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Mary confesses to an affair with Dick's arch-enemy Professor Strudwick, prompting the indignant alien to embark on a revenge fling with the scholar's wife, while Sally falls for a leather-clad Officer Don all over again. Comedy, starring John Lithgow and Jane Curtin

programme.title: 3rd Rock from the Sun
programme.desc: Dick wrecks the car, making his fellow aliens realise how much they relied on it, while Harry finds out about insurance. Comedy series, starring John Lithgow

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Jealousy rears its ugly head when his inexperienced colleague Andy achieves Ray's lifelong ambition of having an article published in Sports Illustrated magazine

programme.title: Everybody Loves Raymond
programme.desc: Robert and Amy split up and Ray is left to take the blame for making disparaging remarks about marriage. American comedy, starring Ray Romano and Brad Garrett

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Bart, Homer and Lisa eat too many sweets and suffer from nightmares on the most spooky night of the year - Halloween. Lisa accidentally leaves the world defenceless from an alien invasion, Bart's Village of the Damned-style mind power turns his dad into a jack-in-the-box and Homer becomes Mr Burns's robot. Featuring the guest voice of James Earl Jones

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Homer buys Lisa a pony in a bid to prove his love for her, but the family cannot afford the gift. To make ends meet and pay for the animal's upkeep, he is forced to take on a second job at the Kwik-E-Mart

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Shamed by his abject failure to score on a test from the National Fatherhood Institute, Homer resolves to become a model parent by helping Bart build a go-kart capable of winning a local race

programme.title: Sunday Brunch
programme.desc: Tim Lovejoy and Simon Rimmer are joined by actors Dylan Llewellyn and Zahra Ahmadi, who talk about the upcoming Death in Paradise spin-off, Beyond Paradise. Comedian Fern Brady discusses her memoir, Strong Female Character, and Clive Anderson chats about his tour, Me, Macbeth and I. Plus, there's live music by country-pop duo Ward Thomas

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Moe steals Homer's idea for a new cocktail and uses it to revive his tavern's flagging fortunes - a move that does not go down too well in the Simpson household. Featuring the voices of rock band Aerosmith, who make Moe's their official nightly hang-out

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: German businessmen buy the nuclear power plant from Mr Burns and make sweeping changes - starting by sacking Homer, whose laziness and ineptitude are at odds with their reputation for efficiency

programme.title: Madagascar 3: Europe's Most Wanted (2012)
programme.desc: The escaped zoo animals continue their quest to get back to their New York home. Having made it to Monte Carlo, they join a circus on a European tour as a means of travelling undetected - but an animal control agent is in hot pursuit. Animated comedy, with the voices of Ben Stiller, Chris Rock, David Schwimmer and Jada Pinkett Smith

programme.title: Scotland's Scenic Railways
programme.desc: A historic section of the East Fife coastal railway is prepared for reopening in a celebration of the golden age of steam. However, the presence of beavers living beneath the line threatens to cause disastrous flooding. Trainee conductor Melanie attempts to join the ranks of Scotland's train crew, and the piper and dancers of the Atholl Highlanders perform a tartan takeover at King's Cross station

programme.title: Matt Baker: Our Farm in the Dales
programme.desc: Janice says an emotional goodbye to some of her beloved Hampshire Down sheep, and Matt's plan to build a patio and seating area in front of the farmhouse begins to take shape. Meanwhile, with the body of the Dodge fully stripped, Matt and the restoration garage team face the challenge of separating it from its chassis, and Nicola accompanies Mike on a shopping trip in search of ingredients for a celebratory paella

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather

programme.title: The Andrew Neil Show
programme.desc: Labour's Leader in Scotland Anas Sarwar and Alex Salmond - former SNP First Minster and now leader of Alba - discuss what the resignation of SNP leader Nicola Sturgeon means for the Scottish independence. Plus, a debate on how to get the UK economy back on track

programme.title: World's Most Secret Hotels
programme.desc: More hidden hotels are revealed in Uruguay, Sweden, Scotland, Oman and the Netherlands - from a camouflaged resort perched on the edge of a mountain, to mainland Britain's most isolated hotel. The Kolarbyn Eco Lodge in Sweden is a rustic retreat of 12 hobbit-like huts that are replicas of those built in the forest by people making charcoal from as far back as the 1800s, while in Norfolk, there's a chance to see an unusual 200-year-old building known as Cley Windmill

programme.title: The Great Pottery Throw Down
programme.desc: The six remaining potters discover their wild sides, as they create metallic-effect endangered animal sculptures fired in oil drums, before judges Keith and Rich set a surprise second challenge to throw a tall, thin-necked vase. Who will beast their way to the quarter-final, and who will be heading home?

programme.title: Guy Martin's Great British Power Trip
programme.desc: Guy Martin visits the most important place in the entire national grid - the central control room - where electricity is bought, sold and routed every single second of the day. Temporarily tasked with the challenging job of keeping the country's lights on, Guy spends thousands of pounds in just a few minutes balancing the electricity supply-and-demand market, before his attention turns to the rise of renewable energy. He works with the army, who are pioneering a new solar-powered workshop, before embarking on the gruelling training required to become an off-shore wind farm technician

programme.title: Ukraine from Above: Secrets from the Frontline
programme.desc: A year after Russia's invasion, this documentary charts the heroic efforts of Ukraine's people to defeat Russia's army in a war that's often been fought and observed from the air. Military strategists use satellite data to plan their next move and investigators gather images from space to reveal suspected Russian war crimes, while drone photography of key locations from before and after the war demonstrate the scale of destruction

programme.title: Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World (2003)
programme.desc: The captain of a British warship engages in a tense battle of wits and an escalating test of nerves with a French counterpart during the Napoleonic conflict, a pursuit that takes his crew on a dangerous journey along the coast of South America. Seafaring drama, adapted from Patrick O'Brian's novels, starring Russell Crowe, Paul Bettany, James D'Arcy, Billy Boyd and Edward Woodall

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay revisits three of the most difficult cases he has taken on since the series began. First, he returns to Cafe Hon in Baltimore, Maryland, where owner Denise Whiting was trapped in a nasty battle with the community and had threatened the locals with lawsuits. Next, the chef goes back to Chiarella's in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania. When he first visited owners Tommy and Dina DeFino, the business was struggling so badly that Tommy had completely lost his confidence and wife Dina had lost her patience. On his final stop, Gordon travels to Leone's in Montclair, New Jersey, where Rose Leone was depending on her lazy son Michael to run the restaurant

programme.title: Dispatches
programme.desc: The extraordinary story of Russia's covert attempts to corrupt British politics, influence government policy and undermine our democracy in the years before the invasion of Ukraine. Over the past 12 years, donors with links to Russia have poured millions into the coffers of the ruling Conservative Party. Dispatches reveals how senior politicians ignored the warnings about President Putin to the detriment of our national security, how political activists were encouraged to visit a Moscow strip club, and hears allegations concerning a Russian 'diplomat' seeking information from a government minister over a pint in a pub

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Chauffeur James hosts the first of five parties in Surrey, hoping his Caribbean menu can impress music tutor Caroline, hairdresser Ben, nail technician Myle and sales director John

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Myle serves up traditional Vietnamese food on the second night in Surrey, but the pressure is intensified when her mum pays a visit

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Ben hosts a Mexican fiesta for the third night of the competition in Surrey, hoping to win over his guests with a night of mariachis and pinatas

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth to host in Surrey is 56-year-old music teacher Caroline, who hopes an evening of singing, dancing and nursery rhymes will increase her chances of bagging the money

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Uber-competitive businessman John is banking on his home-cooked menu to bag him the prize at the end of the night. However, John's one-upmanship and lengthy anecdotes have annoyed hairdresser Ben, who feels that he would be the smuggest contestant ever if he wins

programme.title: Location, Location, Location

However, after two years of looking and 60 properties viewed, the pair are struggling. Phil teams up with teachers Richard and Jo, who need to find a family home before term starts. But it needs to be a property good enough to get Richard excited

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Carrie returns to college, but discovers she does not have enough time to work and study. Meanwhile, Doug worries that an educated woman like her will not be interested in a blue-collar man like him. Ricki Lake guest stars

programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug decides the family needs a new car, but Carrie urges him not to buy one, afraid an impending strike at his workplace may put a crimp in their finances. Unfortunately, he yields to temptation and splashes out on an expensive off-roader

programme.desc: Spring arrives and after months of lockdown, the boys are all heading back to school, meaning Graham can get stuck in to project managing the house build. Plus, was barman Simon from Skegness able to keep his businesses afloat during the Covid-19 pandemic?

In Israel, George visits Tel Aviv to discover how the city is home to the world's greatest collection of Bauhaus buildings and, back in the UK, he discovers a white van that holds a secret - a Tolkien-inspired home hidden inside

programme.title: SAS: Who Dares Wins
programme.desc: The remaining recruits' will to survive is severely tested with an extraction task used in the Vietnam War, and there's an intense beasting in a fight for the survival of the fittest. programme.desc: Fred and the staff serve an extra portion of romance for Valentine's Day and for guests like Brendan who has been on around a thousand dates, it might just be their special night. After an arranged marriage at a young age 42 year-old Annie has been out of the dating game for a long time, will 50 year-old Dave be the man of her dreams? 27 year-old 'clubbing queen' Amanda is fed up of men being too keen too soon, she's hoping club rep Ryan will be different. programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Tom bought the restaurant for his daughter Andrea, but six years later he's still refusing to let her run it. Can the chef break Tom's iron grip on the business and persuade him to change his outdated approach?

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of two architects who are planning to build an eco-friendly subterranean house underneath a ruined 300-year-old barn in the Cotswolds. In one of the most challenging projects seen on the programme, Helen and Chris Seymour Smith build a steel frame around the barn while they excavate underneath, aiming to create a home that is airtight and needs no heating

programme.title: George Clarke's Old House, New Home
programme.desc: The architect meets Duncan and Josie, who are taking on an 18th-century barn perched on the edge of a pretty green, containing some very dodgy décor including a purple striped '80s kitchen and a miniature kitchen extension built to house a washing machine. Duncan and Josie need to make it liveable very quickly as they welcome their new baby Ruby, so George sets out to make the dark, cramped layout work for modern family living. He also heads to Southport, Merseyside, to see a Victorian gothic property in need of attention. Owners Jenny and Fadi are keen to resore the pile to its original splendor

programme.title: The Great British Dig: History in Your Back Garden
programme.desc: Hugh Dennis is joined by a team of expert archaeologists to excavate back gardens around Britain, uncovering the lost history buried beneath our lawns and flower beds. programme.title: William & Kate: Future of the Crown

The programme examines the lifelong preparation William has gone through for his eventual role as king and how public attitudes to the couple have shifted over the years, as well as considering what their eventual reign will be like

programme.title: Secrets of the Royal Palaces
programme.desc: Behind-the-scenes tales of Osborne House on the Isle of Wight, which was bought by Queen Victoria and Prince Albert in 1840 and was turned into their perfect renaissance hideaway. Kate Williams goes on a culinary adventure and tries traditional Tudor cuisine, including snails and pigs' feet, while the horrors of the palaces' bedding ceremony is revealed, where a royal bride is observed on her wedding night to make sure the marriage is consummated

programme.title: Carry On: Secrets & Scandals
programme.desc: Made on the tiniest of budgets, the films in the Carry On franchise made millions at the box office, and are still regularly repeated on TV. This programme reveals the truth behind the films' cheeky, cheerful image, with behind-the-scenes stories about how they were made, including shocking secrets from the series' stars. The documentary broadcasts, for the first time, interviews recorded by cast members at an event in 1998, where they reveal their true feelings about their treatment at the hands of producer Peter Rogers

programme.title: When Classic Films Go Horribly Wrong
programme.desc: Big screen slip-ups from the likes of Tom Cruise, Bruce Willis and Tippi Hedren. Mark Ruffalo puts his foot in it when he reveals the plot of Avengers: Infinity War. Fans are left baffled by Hollywood blockbuster Cats, and poor CGI befalls Justice League, with Henry Cavill's moustache getting attention for all the wrong reasons. Plus, Robert Downey Jr's Welsh accent in Dolittle leaves fans scratching their heads, and there's an uproar at the release of Monty Python's Life of Brian. Contributors include John Thomson, Patsy Kensit, comedian Rufus Hound and veteran actors Madeline Smith, Valerie Leon and Derren Nesbitt

programme.title: Mysteries of the Bermuda Triangle
programme.desc: Documentary about the area of the north Atlantic between Florida, Puerto Rico and Bermuda where it is alleged many boats and aeroplanes have gone missing. Stories about strange events in the region include a US Coast Guard ship that detected a phantom landmass on its radar, two 'ghost rockets' that flew silently over a US Navy ship and Russian submarines that reported all manner of bizarre activity. There are interviews with some of the leading experts on this mystery, air traffic controllers Bob Greene and Bob Gish, pilots Bruce Gernon and Fred Grieser, underwater explorers Evan Kovacs and Les Savege and weather expert Dr Stephen Leatherman

programme.title: Dinosaur with Stephen Fry
programme.desc: The actor examines the early Cretaceous period, an era that saw an explosion in dinosaur diversity 125 million years ago. In a vast and sandy virtual river valley, he sets off in search of the fearsome velociraptor, only to find that this dreaded dinosaur made famous in the Jurassic Park films was in reality no bigger than a turkey. Stephen is joined by expert Dr Dean Lomax to observe the remarkable behaviour of this highly intelligent predator, before heading to the US to meet the dinosaur hunter who first discovered the Utahraptor

programme.title: 22 Kids & Counting
programme.desc: It is Noel and Sue Radford's 30th wedding anniversary and they expect to celebrate it with a romantic meal, but their children have other ideas and are hatching a plan to send them on a dream trip abroad. But it is put in jeopardy when the Radfords' youngest refuses to be weaned off breast milk, and Noel is overcome with worry about leaving the bakery in the sole hands of Luke

programme.title: Who Killed Lin & Megan Russell?
programme.desc: A look at the complex story of the 1996 murders of Lin Russell and her six-year-old daughter Megan as they walked home from school in Chillenden, Kent, a brutal crime that shocked the nation. Despite a lack of forensic evidence, Michael Stone was convicted, and the verdict was upheld at a 2001 re-trial, but in 2022 convicted killer Levi Bellfield reportedly claimed responsibility for the murders, prompting more questions about Stone's guilt. Featuring testimony from experts in policing, forensics and criminology, as wel as people who worked and reported on the case, this documentary tells the story of one of the most controversial and tragic criminal cases that Britain has ever witnessed

Superhero adventure, starring Miles Teller, Michael B Jordan, Kate Mara and Jamie Bell

programme.desc: A spacecraft transporting thousands of people to a distant planet malfunctions. Sci-fi drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Chris Pratt and Michael Sheen

programme.desc: A gang of criminals kidnaps a couple and holds them hostage at an abandoned house in the middle of nowhere. As the crooks' plans start to unravel and they end up killing one of their captives, they come under attack from a mysterious psychopath who intends to make sure no one gets out of the building alive. Horror, starring Luke Evans and Adelaide Clemens

programme.title: Brawl in Cell Block 99 (2017)
programme.desc: A former boxer is blackmailed into performing a prison hit by a ruthless drug kingpin. Crime thriller, starring Vince Vaughn, Jennifer Carpenter and Don Johnson

programme.title: Black Knight (2001)
programme.desc: An employee at a run-down medieval theme park suffers a nasty fall and knocks himself out - only to wake up in 14th-century England, where he gets up to all manner of mischief with the knights in shining armour and damsels in distress. Comedy adventure, starring Martin Lawrence, Tom Wilkinson and Marsha Thomason

programme.title: Kindergarten Cop (1990)
programme.desc: A tough detective is forced to pose as a preschool teacher in a bid to capture a drug dealer whose son is one of the pupils. However, his biggest challenge turns out to be controlling a class full of five-year-olds. Comedy, starring Arnold Schwarzenegger, Penelope Ann Miller, Linda Hunt, Pamela Reed and Richard Tyson

programme.title: Sense and Sensibility (1995)
programme.desc: An impoverished family is taken in by a relative - and while sensible elder daughter Elinor's love for the sensitive Edward Ferrars meets with disapproval from his family, her more passionate younger sister Marianne engages in a disastrous romance with an infamous womaniser. Period drama based on Jane Austen's novel, directed by Ang Lee and starring Emma Thompson, Kate Winslet, Alan Rickman and Hugh Grant

programme.title: Hidden Figures (2016)
programme.desc: As the space race reaches fever pitch in the early 1960s, a trio of female African-American mathematicians attempt to overcome prejudice and find work with NASA. Their remarkable skills prove vital in getting an astronaut into orbit and bringing him safely back to Earth, but to realise their potential they must overcome deep-seated prejudice in the space programme and society as a whole. Fact-based drama, starring Taraji P Henson, Octavia Spencer, Janelle Monae and Kevin Costner

programme.title: Inside Man (2006)
programme.desc: A police hostage negotiator is called in when a robbery turns into a siege. The chairman of the bank involved is worried the mastermind behind the heist is set to disclose secrets he needs to stay hidden, so he enlists the help of a political fixer. However, the elaborate nature of the thief's plan looks set to keep him one step ahead of the law, and causes problems for the detective assigned to rectify the situation. Spike Lee's thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Clive Owen, Jodie Foster, Christopher Plummer, Willem Dafoe and Chiwetel Ejiofor

programme.title: Brothers in Arms (2019)
programme.desc: A by-the-book police officer serving in the Marine Corps Reserves is driven to take drastic measures when his brother is arrested after a bar fight and given an unfair prison sentence. Action thriller, starring Jai Courtney, Nat Wolff and Leighton Meester

programme.title: An Unsuitable Job for a Woman (1981)
programme.desc: A female detective hired to investigate the suicide of a wealthy businessman's son becomes obsessed with the dead youth. Thriller, starring Billie Whitelaw, Paul Freeman, Pippa Guard and Dominic Guard

programme.title: BSL Zone: Wild Visitors to My Home
The Blue Dahlia (1946)
programme.desc: A war-weary pilot returns home from service in Europe, but his welcome is far from warm. Not only must he deal with the news of his wife's infidelities, but he also finds himself accused of her murder. However, the wife of his dead spouse's lover is on hand to help him prove his innocence. Thriller, written by Raymond Chandler and starring Alan Ladd, Veronica Lake, William Bendix and Doris Dowling

programme.title: 12 Angry Men (1957)
programme.desc: Twelve jurors convene to decide the verdict in a murder trial. While 11 of the group are thoroughly convinced the teenage defendant is guilty, one lone voice of reason refuses to cave in to pressure and passionately argues the case for his innocence. Sidney Lumet's legal drama, starring Henry Fonda, Lee J Cobb, Ed Begley, Martin Balsam and Jack Klugman

programme.title: The Black Shield of Falworth (1954)
programme.desc: The son of a disgraced medieval nobleman is raised in poverty. With the support of a kindly earl, he gains the chance to train as a knight and reclaim his birthright, proving his worth by fighting to foil a plot to overthrow the king. Swashbuckling adventure, starring Tony Curtis, Janet Leigh, David Farrar and Barbara Rush

programme.title: The Tall T (1957)
programme.desc: A ranch hand hitches a ride on a stagecoach after losing his horse, but things go from bad to worse when the vehicle is hijacked by outlaws. The cowboy tries to bargain for the release of his fellow hostages - a newlywed couple - but his pleas fall on stony ground once the bandit leader learns the new bride is a rich heiress. Western, with Randolph Scott, Richard Boone, Maureen O'Sullivan and Henry Silva

programme.title: A Beautiful Day in the Neighborhood (2019)
programme.desc: In 1998, magazine journalist Lloyd Vogel is sent to interview beloved TV entertainer Fred Rogers, an assignment he feels is beneath him. However, a friendship soon forms between the two men. Director Marielle Heller's drama based on a true story, starring an Oscar and Bafta-nominated Tom Hanks, Matthew Rhys and Chris Cooper

programme.title: War for the Planet of the Apes (2017)
programme.desc: A devastating conflict erupts between humans and intelligent primates in a post-apocalyptic future. The leader of the apes is determined to make peace and prove his people are not savages - but a tragic course of events leaves him wrestling with a desire for revenge. Sci-fi adventure sequel, the conclusion of the trilogy of prequels to the 1968 movie. Starring Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn

programme.title: The Untouchables (1987)
programme.desc: Incorruptible federal agent Eliot Ness is assigned the task of fighting organised crime in Prohibition-era Chicago and bringing the notorious crime boss Al Capone to justice. Aware crooked police are undermining his investigations, he puts together his own elite squad to take on the Mob. Brian De Palma's crime thriller, with Kevin Costner, Robert De Niro, Andy Garcia and Sean Connery, who won an Oscar for his performance

programme.title: Skin Trade (2014)
programme.desc: After his family is killed by a Serbian gangster with international interests, a New York detective goes to south-east Asia to team up with a Thai detective to destroy the syndicate's human trafficking network. Thriller, starring Dolph Lundgren, Tony Jaa, Michael Jai White and Ron Perlman

programme.title: Rude(ish) Tube
programme.desc: Comedy clips showcasing amusing internet videos, featuring ducks going up an escalator, animal impressions, and a few narrow escapes on a snowboard and rally driving

programme.title: Don't Tell the Bride
programme.desc: Former boxing champ and groom-to-be Jordan plans a fight-night wedding in front of thousands of people, but his fiancee Danielle dreams of a girly and intimate wedding day

programme.title: Lego Masters Australia

programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay checks in at the 90-year-old Monticello Hotel in Longview, Washington, where owner Phillip Lovingfoss has an apparent liking for alcohol that some of his staff claim is threatening to destroy the business. programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell

programme.title: Ramsay's Hotel Hell

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

It's not an easy decision because the properties present the couple with a tricky dilemma of whether to buy on the coast or in the country

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Robin and Susan Loxton from Suffolk want to seize the day and buy a holiday home near Mijas, in their favourite part of southern Spain. Danni Menzies shows them some serious property contenders that offer amazing value, but whether any of them will prove 'the perfect fit' remains to be seen

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Lyndsey and Paul from Glasgow are newly engaged and want to kick start the next chapter of their lives together by buying a family holiday home in the area around Oliva in eastern Spain. Ben Hillman leaves no stone unturned to find property contenders for their budget of £50,000

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with two sets of househunters whose searches were all about family. Retired couple Tom and Sue are living in their motorhome having sold their beloved cottage in Tom's native Yorkshire. The plan is to move 150 miles south to be near Sue's grandson - and they long for an open-plan home with a huge garden. Meanwhile, doting father Charlie, who is recently divorced, and his two children would like a new family home in Kent to start a new chapter in their lives

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with three house-hunters with two very different needs, but one shared goal. In 2018, schoolteacher Katy, her comedian husband Charlie, baby daughter Lola, and pet pooch Harper were on the hunt for their first family home in Brighton. Having moved in with Katy's mum to save for a deposit, they had not only grown used to home comforts, but also the vibrant village atmosphere of pricey Fiveways - an area where their property dreams didn't match their budget. With Phil's help they widened the net, viewing four fantastic finds in and around Brighton. Two years later, Phil's back to see whether life on the coast has been plain sailing. And in 2019, Kirstie was scouring east London with 'granny on the go' Janet. Having been diagnosed with a degenerative back condition, Janet was desperate to ditch her lift-less, third storey flat in exchange for a ground-floor forever home. The tricky east London property market was proving tough to navigate though, and Kirstie soon f

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Fun-loving Sonya Smith is the first to host the dinner-party challenge from Reading, Berkshire, and aims to win over the guests with a Touch of Sparkle theme. Aware her cooking skills leave a lot to be desired, she hopes to bungle her way through the night, and though she is amused by the kitchen chaos, not everyone is impressed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Londoner Glen Wilkie hosts the second dinner party of the week in Reading, Berkshire, and is confident of victory. However, a disaster with his dessert gets the day off to a bad start, and his main course, which he has chosen to call Bambi on a Plate, leaves one guest in tears - while another flatly refuses to eat it

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mature student Richard Howse hosts the third dinner party in Reading, using a menu and set of instructions provided by his girlfriend to guide him. A treasure hunt brings out Glen Wilkie's feelings about Serine Daou, Sonya Smith dislikes some of the gluten-free food and, for the third night in a row, Sabi Phagura is served a plate of meat she will not eat

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The fourth dinner party in Reading sees fitness fanatic Sabi Phagura putting her healthy regimen to one side to host a bhangra-themed evening. Unfortunately, neither the traditional Indian food on the table nor the entertainment seems to impress the guests

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Corset-maker Serine Daou hosts the final night of the culinary competition in Reading, Berkshire, and hopes to impress with her burlesque-themed party. When the gourmet burgers she serves fail to impress, she must rely on the evening's entertainment to put her back on course for the £1,000 prize

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Rob and Jo Smith's dog-friendly B&B in Hope Mountain, north Wales. Eyebrows are raised when self-styled 'queens of clean' Steffi Stephenson and Sarah Banks find evidence of their pet hate. During an afternoon making jam, identical twins Fernando and Emilio Tundidor reveal a competitive streak. At breakfast, Denise and Alan Newman are surprisingly demanding

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At the Beaumont Hotel in Louth, Lincolnshire, two guests are damning about the breakfast quality, so it remains to be seen how managers Steffi Stevenson and Sarah Banks will react

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to Rock House Hotel in Lynmouth, Devon, where owner Emilio Tundidor is being ably assisted by his identical twin brother Fernando

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Troy House in Painswick, Gloucestershire, where owners Alan and Denise Newman hope the guests will love their rooms, but Emilio and Fernando are on the warpath

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day in the competition sees the B&B owners meet up for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores

programme.title: Amanda Owen's Farming Lives
programme.desc: Amanda visits Muhsen, Elif and their three children in Pontypool south Wales to see how these self-taught farmers learned how to raise goats, sheep and cows and produce their own fuel to grow and farm vegetables.

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Linden, 15, is brought to A&E having badly cut his leg while back-flipping off a shed roof onto a trampoline. As well as calling an ambulance, his friends filmed the accident on their mobile phones and happily show the clip to the staff at King's. Junior doctor Sammy looks after 88-year-old Panayiota, who has been referred to hospital with breathing difficulties. Originally from Cyprus, the patient speaks very little English and Sammy has to contact a translator to help with the diagnosis and treatment. Meanwhile, 55-year-old lorry driver Antony has lost all feeling in his left leg, and an ultrasound scan reveals he needs emergency surgery on a blocked artery to save his limb

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: It's a busy Mother's Day at south London's King's College Hospital as 23-year-old builder Jamie is rushed in by paramedics having fallen from the roof of a three-storey building, landing on a brick wall. The team performs an emergency ultrasound to determine whether he has suffered internal injuries or fractured his ribs and spine, and spot a punctured lung that needs to be reinflated. Four-month-old Weston has been brought to paediatric A&E after suffering from diarrhoea and vomiting for more than 24 hours, while doctors suspect David, 74, has had a stroke. Junior doctor Matt looks after 80-year-old Daphne, who has dislocated her replacement hip

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts as Lee Mack and Joe Wilkinson take on Jon Richardson and Jessica Knappett. Comedian Nigel Ng is in Dictionary Corner. Regular Countdown mathematician Rachel Riley and lexicographer Susie Dent are on hand to adjudicate

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
